text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth, for the LORD speaks, I have nourished and brought up sons, and they have rebelled against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ox knows his owner, and the ass his master’s crib; but Israel does not know, my people do not have understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: O sinful nation, people laden with iniquity, generation of evildoers, corrupt sons! They have forsaken the LORD; they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger; they have turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should I chastise you any more? Ye will revolt more and more; every head is sick, and every heart faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in him; but wounds, and bruises, and putrefying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your country is desolate; your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except the LORD of the hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the word of the LORD, ye princes of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? shall the LORD say. I am full of the burnt offerings of rams and the fat of fed beasts; and I do not delight in the blood of bullocks or of lambs or of he goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: When ye come to appear before me, who has required this at your hand, to tread my courts?
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring no more vain oblations; the incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot stand them; iniquity and the solemn meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hates: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide my eyes from you; likewise, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear; your hands are full of blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash yourselves, make yourselves clean; put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; cease to do evil;
speaker: Narrator

text: learn to do good; seek judgment; restore unto the oppressed; hear the fatherless in right judgment; protect the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then come, shall the LORD say, and we shall be even; if your sins were as scarlet, they shall be made as white as snow; if they were red like crimson, they shall become as wool.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye are willing and hearken, ye shall eat the good of the land;
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword; for the mouth of the LORD has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: How is the faithful city become a harlot! It was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it, but now murderers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy princes are rebellious and companions of thieves; every one loves bribes and follows after rewards; they do not hear the fatherless in judgment, neither does the cause of the widow come unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore saith the Lord, the LORD of the hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease myself of my adversaries and avenge myself of my enemies;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will turn my hand upon thee and according to pureness purge away thy dross and take away all thy tin;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will restore thy judges as at the first and thy counsellors as at the beginning; afterward thou shalt be called The city of righteousness, the faithful city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion shall be ransomed with judgment and her converts with righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and those that forsook the LORD shall be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the groves that ye have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf falls and as a garden that has no water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strong idol shall be as tow and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and no one shall be able to quench them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in the last of the days or times, that the mountain of the LORD’s house shall be confirmed as the head of the mountains and shall be exalted above the hills; and all the Gentiles shall flow unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many peoples shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths; for out of Zion shall go forth the law and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall judge among the Gentiles and shall rebuke many peoples; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruninghooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Jacob, come and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they are replenished from the east and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots:
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the mean man bows down, and the great man humbles himself; therefore thou shalt not forgive them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust from the terrible presence of the LORD and from the glory of his majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the day of the LORD of the hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon all the cedars of Lebanon that are high and lifted up and upon all the oaks of Bashan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon all the high mountains and upon all the hills that are lifted up,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,
speaker: Narrator

text: and upon all the ships of Tarshish and upon all pleasant pictures.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be made low; and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall utterly abolish the idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks and into the caves of the earth, because of the terrible presence of the LORD and because of the glory of his majesty when he shall arise to smite the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day man shall cast his idols of silver and his idols of gold (which they made each one for himself to worship) into the caves of the moles and of the bats,
speaker: Narrator

text: to go into the clefts of the rocks and into the caverns of the cliffs from before the fearful presence of the LORD and from the glory of his majesty, when he shall arise to smite the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for of what is he to be accounted of?
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the Lord, the LORD of the hosts, takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread and the whole stay of water,
speaker: Narrator

text: the mighty man and the man of war, the judge and the prophet, the fortune-teller and the ancient,
speaker: Narrator

text: the captain of fifty and the honourable man and the counsellor and the cunning artificer and the eloquent wise man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give children to be their princes, and young fools shall rule over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people shall do violence, one against another, and each one against his neighbour; the child shall rise up against the ancient and the base against the honourable.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: in that day he shall swear, saying, I will not be a healer for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: do not make me a ruler of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen because their tongue and their doings have been against the LORD, to irritate the eyes of his majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The appearance of their countenance witnesses against them, and they declare their sin as Sodom; they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! For they have rewarded evil unto themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto the righteous that it shall be well with him, for they shall eat of the fruit of their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto the wicked! It shall be ill with him, for according to the work of his hands it shall be done unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The oppressors of my people are many, and women rule over him. O my people, those who lead thee cause thee to err and twist the way of thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD stands up to litigate and is present to judge the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will come with judgment against the elders of his people and against these his princes, for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: What do you mean that ye beat my people to pieces and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord GOD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the LORD saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and swaggering as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord will make bare the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the LORD will uncover that which they are ashamed of.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the Lord will take away the adornment of their shoes and their hair nets and their crystals,
speaker: Narrator

text: the chains and the jewels and the bracelets,
speaker: Narrator

text: the bonnets and the ornaments of the legs and the headbands and the powders and the earrings,
speaker: Narrator

text: the rings, and nose jewels,
speaker: Narrator

text: the changeable suits of apparel and the mantles and the veils and the crisping pins,
speaker: Narrator

text: the looking glasses and the fine linen and the hoods and the hairdos.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that instead of sweet perfumes, there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent and instead of well-set hair baldness and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth and burning instead of beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy gates shall lament and mourn, and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, We will eat our own bread and wear our own apparel; only let us be called by thy name to take away our reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the branch of the LORD shall be for beauty and glory and the fruit of the earth for greatness and honour to those that are freed of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that he that is left in Zion and he that remains in Jerusalem shall be called holy, even every one that is written among the living in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of burning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD will create upon every dwelling place of Mount Zion and upon the places of her assemblies a cloud and darkness by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night because over all glory there shall be a covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a covert for a shadow in the daytime from the heat and for a place of refuge and for a shelter from storm and from rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now will I sing to my well-beloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My well-beloved had a vineyard in the horn of the sons of oil;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he had fenced it and gathered out the stones thereof and planted it with the choicest vine and built a tower in the midst of it and also made a winepress therein; and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, between me and my vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? Therefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, did it bring forth wild grapes?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away its hedge, and it shall be eaten up; and break down its wall, and it shall be trodden down:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned, nor hoed; but briers and thorns shall come up there; I will even command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the vineyard of the LORD of the hosts is the house of Israel and every man of Judah his pleasant plant; and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that join house to house, that lay field to field, until they have done away with the borders! Will ye dwell alone in the midst of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: In my ears, the LORD of the hosts said, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning that they may continue their drunkenness; that continue until night until wine inflames them!
speaker: Narrator

text: And the harp and the viol, the tambourine and flutes and wine are in their feasts; but they do not regard the work of the LORD, nor consider the work of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my people are gone into captivity because they have no knowledge; their glory died of hunger, and their multitude dried up of thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Sheol has enlarged himself and opened his mouth without measure; and their glory, and their multitude descended into it and their pomp and he that rejoiced in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD of the hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God, that is holy, shall be sanctified with righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the lambs shall be fed after their manner, and strangers shall eat the fat ones that are forsaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope,
speaker: Narrator

text: that say, Let him make speed and hasten his work that we may see it, and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come that we may know it!
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that call evil good and good evil; that put darkness for light and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter!
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that are wise in their own eyes and prudent in their own sight!
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that are mighty to drink wine and men of strength to mingle strong drink;
speaker: Narrator

text: who justify the wicked for bribes and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore as the fire devours the stubble and the flame consumes the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go away as dust because they have cast away the law of the LORD of the hosts and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people, and he has stretched forth his hand against them and has smitten them; and the mountains trembled, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will lift up a banner as an example to Gentiles that are far and will hiss unto those that are in the end of the earth; and behold, they shall come with speed swiftly:
speaker: Narrator

text: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken;
speaker: Narrator

text: whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent; their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and the wheels of their chariots like a whirlwind;
speaker: Narrator

text: their roaring shall be like a lion: they shall roar like young lions; they shall gnash their teeth and lay hold of the prey and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea; and if one looks unto the land, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above it stood the seraphims; each one had six wings; with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one cried out unto another and said, Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of the hosts; the whole earth is full of his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried out, and the house was filled with smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, Woe is me! for I am dead because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one of the seraphim flew unto me, having a live coal in his hand which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he laid it upon my mouth and said, Behold, this has touched thy lips; and it shall take away thy guilt, and thy sin shall be cleansed.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, I heard the voice of the Lord saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I answered, Here am I; send me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Go and tell this people, Hear indeed, but do not understand; and see indeed, but do not perceive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make the heart of this people fat and make their ears heavy and blind their eyes that they not see with their eyes, nor hear with their ears, nor understand with their heart, nor convert and there be healing for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities are wasted without inhabitant and not a man in the houses, and the land is turned into desert,
speaker: Narrator

text: until the LORD has removed men far away, and there is great solitude in the midst of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But yet in it shall remain a tenth, and it shall return and shall be razed; as the teil tree and as the oak, of which the stump remains alive when they are cut down, likewise in these his stump shall remain holy seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told the house of David, saying Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved and the heart of his people as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the LORD said unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the washer’s field
speaker: Narrator

text: and say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; do not fear, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have taken evil counsel against thee saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us go up against Judah and vex it, and let us divide it between us and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord GOD, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the head of Syria shall be Damascus, and the head of Damascus Rezin; and within sixty-five years Ephraim shall be broken, and it shall never again be a people.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the meantime the head of Ephraim shall be Samaria, and the head of Samaria, Remaliah’s son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the LORD spoke again unto Ahaz, saying
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask a sign of the LORD thy God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Isaiah, Hear ye now, O house of David, Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son and shall call his name Immanuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall eat butter and honey that he may know to refuse the evil and choose the good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good; the land that thou dost abhor shall be forsaken of both her kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall bring upon thee and upon thy people and upon thy father’s house days that have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even unto the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall come and all of them shall rest in the desolate valleys and in the holes of the rocks and upon all thorns and upon all bushes.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same day the Lord shall raze with a razor that is hired, namely, by them beyond the river by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet and it shall also consume the beard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that a man shall nourish a young cow and two sheep;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it shall come to pass for the abundance of milk that they shall give, he shall eat butter; for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that in the place where there were a thousand vines that were worth a thousand shekels of silver, it shall even be for the briers and for the thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: With arrows and with bows shall men come there because all the land shall become briers and thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fear of briers and thorns shall not come unto all the hills that were dug with the hoe, but they shall be for pasture of oxen and for the treading of the lesser cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the LORD said unto me, Take a great roll and write in it with a man’s pen concerning Mahershalal-hashbaz. {Heb. Hurry to the spoil, make haste to the prey}
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I went unto the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son. Then the LORD said to me, Call his name Mahershalalhashbaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father and my mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be taken away before the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD also spoke unto me again, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Forasmuch as this people refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly and rejoiced in Rezin and Remaliah’s son,
speaker: Narrator

text: now therefore, behold, the Lord brings up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his power, and he shall come up over all his channels and go over all his banks:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries, prepare yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take counsel together, and it shall come to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand, for God is with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD spoke thus to me with a strong hand and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not say, A confederacy, to all those to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear their fear, nor be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify the LORD of the hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock to cause a fall to both the houses of Israel, for a snare and for a net to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many among them shall stumble and fall and be broken and be snared and be taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind up the testimony; seal the law among my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will wait for the LORD, who hid his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I and the children whom the LORD has given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the LORD of the hosts, who dwells in Mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they shall say unto you, Seek unto spiritists and unto wizards that peep and that mutter; shall the people not seek unto their God? Shall we appeal for the living unto the dead?
speaker: Narrator

text: To the law and to the testimony! If they do not speak according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall pass through this land, fatigued and hungry, and it shall come to pass that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves and curse their king and their God. And raising their face high,
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall look upon the earth and behold tribulation and gross darkness, darkness and anguish; and they shall be submerged in gross darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless this darkness shall not be the same as the affliction that came upon her when they lightly touched the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, nor afterward when they more grievously afflicted her by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, in Galilee of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; those that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them has the light shined.
speaker: Narrator

text: As thou hast multiplied the nation, thou hast not increased the joy. They shall rejoice before thee as they rejoice in the harvest and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast broken his heavy yoke and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, as in the day of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every battle of him who fights is with shaking of the earth and the rolling of garments in blood; but this shall be with burning and consuming of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given, and the government is placed upon his shoulder, and his name shall be called The Wonderful One, The Counsellor, The God, The Mighty One, The Eternal Father, The Prince of Peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The multitude of his dominion and the peace shall have no end upon the throne of David and upon his Kingdom, ordering it and confirming it in judgment and in righteousness from now on even for ever. The zeal of the LORD of the hosts will perform this.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it has lighted upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in pride and arrogance of heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the wild fig trees are cut down, but we will put cedars in their place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the LORD shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him and join his enemies together,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people did not turn unto him that smote them, neither did they seek the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush, in one day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ancient and venerable to look upon is the head; the prophet that teaches lies, he is the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the governors of this people are deceivers, and those who are governed by them are lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall he have mercy on their fatherless and widows, for every one is a hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaks folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wickedness burns as the fire, it shall devour the briers and thorns and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through the wrath of the LORD of the hosts the land is darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire; no man shall spare his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall snatch on the right hand and be hungry, and he shall eat on the left hand, and they shall not be satisfied; they shall eat each man the flesh of his own arm:
speaker: Narrator

text: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that establish unrighteous laws and that wilfully prescribe tyranny
speaker: Narrator

text: to turn aside the poor from right judgment and to take away the right from the afflicted of my people that widows may be their prey and that they may rob the fatherless!
speaker: Narrator

text: And what will ye do in the day of visitation and in the desolation which shall come from far? To whom will ye flee for help and where will ye leave your glory?
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bow down among the prisoners, and they shall fall among the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Assyrian, rod and staff of my anger, in thy hand have I placed my indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send him against a hypocritical nation, and upon the people of my wrath will I send him to take spoil and to take prey and to ready them that they might be tread down like the mire of the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit he shall not think like this; not even in his heart shall he imagine this way of doing things, but his thought shall be to destroy and cut off nations not a few.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall say, Are not my princes altogether kings?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?
speaker: Narrator

text: As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel those of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
speaker: Narrator

text: shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord has performed his whole work upon Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will come upon the fruit of the pride of the heart of the king of Assyria, and upon the glory of his high looks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I have been prudent: and I have removed the boundaries of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures, and I have cast down as valiant ones those who were seated:
speaker: Narrator

text: And my hand has found as a nest the riches of the peoples: and as one gathers eggs that are left, I have taken control over all the earth; and there was no one that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the axe boast itself against him that hews with it? or shall the saw magnify itself against him that moves it? as if the rod should rise up against those that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift itself up. Is it not wood?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the Lord, the LORD of the hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall consume the glory of his forest and of his fruitful field, from the soul unto the flesh; and they shall come to be as a standard-bearer in defeat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the trees that shall remain in his forest shall be in number such that a child may count them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that those who shall be left of Israel and those who shall be left of the house of Jacob shall no more again stay upon him that smote them, but shall stay upon the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The remnant shall become converted, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet the remnant of them shall become converted; when the consumption comes to an end, righteousness shall overflow.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord GOD of the hosts shall make a consumption and an end in the midst of all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD of the hosts, O my people, dweller of Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian; he shall smite thee with a rod and shall lift up his stick against thee by the way of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: yet from now until a very little while the indignation and my anger shall cease, to make an end of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD of the hosts shall raise up a scourge against him as the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb and shall raise up his rod upon the sea, by the way of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be consumed in the presence of the anointing.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is come to Aiath; he is passed unto Migron; in Michmash he shall number his army:
speaker: Narrator

text: They are gone over the fords; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim; Laish cause poor Anathoth to hear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Madmenah is in upheaval; the inhabitants of Gebim shall gather themselves together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even yet shall come a day when he shall rest at Nob; he shall raise his hand unto the mountain of the daughter of Zion unto the hill of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord, the LORD of the hosts, shall lop the bough with force, and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall cut down the thickness of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by force.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him, the Spirit of wisdom and understanding, the Spirit of counsel and might, the Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall make him of quick olfaction in the fear of the LORD; and he shall not judge according to the sight of his eyes, neither reprove according to the hearing of his ears:
speaker: Narrator

text: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth; and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the spirit of his lips he shall slay the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faith the girdle of his kidneys.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wolf shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a child shall shepherd them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice’ den.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain: for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be in that day that the Root of Jesse, who shall be lifted up as a banner, as an example to the Gentiles shall be sought by the Gentiles; and his Kingdom of peace shall be glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall return to set his hand again to possess the remnant of his people which were left from Assyria and from Egypt and from Pathros and from Cush and from Elam and from Shinar and from Hamath and from the islands of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall raise up a banner, as an example for the Gentiles and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west; they shall spoil those of the east together; they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the sons of Ammon shall obey them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall utterly dry up the tongue of the Egyptian sea and shall raise his hand in the strength of his spirit upon the river and shall smite it into seven streams and make men go over dryshod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a highway for the remnant of his people, which shall be left from Assyria like as it was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day thou shalt say, O LORD, I will sing unto thee; though thou wast angry with me, thine anger is turned away, and thou hast comforted me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, O God my saving health, I will trust and not be afraid for JAH, the LORD, is my strength and my song; he also is become saving health unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day ye shall say, Sing unto the LORD, call upon his name, declare his doings among the peoples, remember how his name is exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing psalms unto the LORD; for he has done excellent things; let this be known in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice and sing, thou inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift ye up a banner as an example upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, raise the hand, that they may enter in by gates of princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have commanded my sanctified ones; I have also called my mighty ones for my anger that they might rejoice with my glory.

text: They come from a far land, from the end of the heavens, even the LORD, and the instruments of his indignation, to destroy the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl; for the day of the LORD is at hand; it shall come as destruction from the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore all hands shall be faint, and every heart of man shall melt:

text: And they shall be filled with terror; anguish and pain shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travails: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the day of the LORD comes, cruel and with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the earth desolate; and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.

text: And I will visit evil upon the world and iniquity upon the wicked, and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease and will lay low the haughtiness of the strong.

text: I will make the noble man more precious than fine gold and man more than the gold of Ophir.

text: Because I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall be moved out of her place, in the indignation of the LORD of the hosts and in the day of his fierce anger.

text: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep without a shepherd: they shall each man look unto his own people, and flee each one unto his own land.

text: Their children shall also be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not look for silver, nor covet gold.

text: They shall shoot at the young boys with bows, and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare the sons.

text: It shall never again be inhabited; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation; neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there, neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures, and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their palaces, and dragons in their pleasant palaces; and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD will have mercy on Jacob and will yet choose Israel and cause them to rest in their own land; and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peoples shall take them and bring them to their place; and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the LORD for slaves and hand maids; and they shall take them captives, whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in the day that the LORD shall give thee rest from thy sorrow and from thy fear and from the hard bondage in which thou wast made to serve,
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon and say, How has the oppressor ceased! The city that covets gold has ceased!
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has broken the staff of the wicked and the sceptre of the rulers
speaker: Narrator

text: who smote the peoples in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the Gentiles in anger and who did not defend the persecuted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole earth is at rest and is quiet; they sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the fir trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all shall shout and say unto thee, Art thou also become sick as we? Art thou become like unto us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy pride is brought down to Sheol, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou shalt be cast down to Sheol, to the sides of the pit.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: that made the world as a wilderness and destroyed the cities thereof; that did not open the prison to his prisoners?
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kings of the Gentiles, even all of them, lie in glory, each one in his own house.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not be numbered with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land and slain thy people; the seed of evildoers shall not be forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare slaughter for his sons for the iniquity of their fathers that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will rise up upon them, saith the LORD of the hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name and remnant and son and nephew, saith the LORD.

speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts has sworn, saying, Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:

speaker: Narrator

text: This is the counsel that is purposed upon the whole earth; and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD of the hosts has purposed, and who shall disannul it? His hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year that King Ahaz died was this burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice not thou, whole Philistia, because thou didst break the rod of him that smote thee: for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.

text: And the firstborn of the poor shall be fed, and the needy shall lie down in safety; and I will cause thy root to die of famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Philistia, art dissolved; for there shall come from the north a smoke, and not one shall be left in thy assemblies.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall one then answer the messengers of the Gentiles? That the LORD has founded Zion, and in her the afflicted of his people shall have confidence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Moab. Certainly in the night Ar of Moab was laid waste and brought to silence; certainly in the night Kir of Moab was laid waste and brought to silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is gone up to Bajith and to Dibon, the altars, to weep; Moab shall howl over Nebo and over Medeba: every head among her shall become bald, and every beard shall be cut off.

text: In their streets they shall gird themselves with sackcloth; on the tops of their houses and in their streets, every one shall howl, weeping as they come down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Heshbon shall cry, and Elealeh: their voice shall be heard even unto Jahaz; therefore the armed soldiers of Moab shall cry out; each one of them shall cry out for his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart shall cry out for Moab; his fugitives shall go up with weeping by the hill of Luhith unto Zoar, a heifer of three years; for in the way of Horonaim they shall raise up a cry of destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the waters of Nimrim have run out: for the grass of the courtyard is withered away, the herb fails, there is no green thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore that which each one has laid up and their riches they shall carry away to the brook of the willows.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the howling thereof unto Eglaim and the clamour thereof unto Beerelim.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the waters of Dimon shall be full of blood; for I will bring more upon Dimon: lions upon him that escapes of Moab and upon the remnant of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land, from the rock of the wilderness unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it shall be that as a wandering bird cast out of the nest so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take counsel; execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; do not betray him that escapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the presence of the destroyer; for the extortioner shall come to an end, the destroyer shall cease, the oppressor shall be consumed out of the land.

text: And in mercy shall the throne be established; and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging and seeking judgment and hastening righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud, even of his haughtiness and his pride and his wrath, but his lies shall not be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab; every one shall howl; for the foundations of Kirhareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the vines of Heshbon were cut off and the vines of Sibmah; the lords of the Gentiles have trodden down the offshoots thereof, which had come even unto Jazer and extended through the wilderness; they had gone over the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping Jazer of the vine of Sibmah; I will cause thee to drink my tears, O Heshbon and Elealeh, for the song shall cease upon thy summer fruits and thy harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And gladness is taken away and joy out of the fertile field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be rejoicing: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage song to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my bowels shall sound like a harp for Moab and my inward parts for Kirharesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass when it is seen that Moab is weary upon the high places that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray, but he shall be unable to.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the word that the LORD has spoken concerning Moab since that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now the LORD has spoken, saying, Within three years, as a hireling counts the years, the glory of Moab shall be cast down, with all her great multitude; and the remnant shall be few, small and feeble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities of Aroer are forsaken; they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The succour of Ephraim shall cease, and the kingdom from Damascus and the remnant of Syria; they shall be as the glory of the sons of Israel, saith the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day it shall come to pass that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.

text: And it shall be as when the harvestman gathers the sheaves and reaps the grain with his arm; and it shall be as he that gathers grain in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet gleaning shall be left in it as when the olive tree is shaken; two or three berries are left in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost fruitful branches thereof, saith the LORD God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that day man shall look to his Maker, and his eyes shall see the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall not look to the altars, the work of his hands; neither shall he look upon that which his fingers have made, either the groves or the images of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the cities of his strength shall be as the gleanings which remain on the shoots and on the branches, which were left of the sons of Israel; and there shall be desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy saving health and hast not been mindful of the Rock of thy strength; therefore thou shalt plant pleasant plants and set it with strange slips:
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day that thou shalt plant them, thou shalt make them to grow and shalt make thy seed to flourish early; but in the day of gathering, the harvest shall flee and shall be desperate sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the multitude of many peoples, which shall make a noise like the noise of the sea; and the rushing of nations, that make an uprising like the rushing of mighty waters!
speaker: Narrator

text: The peoples shall make noise like the rushing of great waters, but God shall reprehend them, and they shall flee far off and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind and like the tumbleweed before the whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold at eveningtide trouble, and before the morning she is not. This is the portion of them that tread on us and the lot of them that spoil us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the land which makes shade with her wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia:
speaker: Narrator

text: He who sends ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of bulrushes upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to the people scattered and peeled, to the people full of fears from their beginning, and until now, a people tired of waiting and trodden down, whose land the rivers have spoiled!
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye inhabitants of the world and neighbours of the land, when he lifts up a banner as an example on the mountains, ye shall see it; and when he blows the shofar, ye shall hear it.

text: For so the LORD said unto me, I will take my rest, and I will look forth from my dwelling place like a clear sun after the rain and like a cloud filled with dew in the heat of the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before the harvest, when the fruit is perfect, and after the flower is past and the fruit is mature, then he shall both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks and take away and cut down the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be left together unto the fowls of the mountains and to the beasts of the earth; and the fowls shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that time the present shall be brought unto the LORD of the hosts, the people scattered and peeled, the people full of fears from their beginning and until now, a people tired of waiting and trodden under foot, whose land the rivers have spoiled, to the place of the name of the LORD of the hosts, to the Mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Egypt. Behold, the LORD rides upon a swift cloud and shall come into Egypt, and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at his presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set the Egyptians against the Egyptians, and they shall fight each one against his brother, and each one against his neighbour; city against city and kingdom against kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst thereof, and I will destroy the counsel thereof; and they shall seek to the idols and to the charmers and to the spiritists and to the wizards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give the Egyptians over into the hand of a cruel lord; and a violent king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall turn the rivers far away, and the brooks of defence shall be emptied and dried up; the reeds and flags shall wither.
speaker: Narrator

text: The vegetables by the river, by the mouth of the river, and every thing sown beside the river shall dry up, wither away, and be no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fishermen also shall mourn, and all those that cast fishhooks into the river shall lament, and those that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover those that work in fine flax and those that weave networks shall be confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because all their nets shall be broken; all that make ponds to raise fish shall be discontented.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the princes of Zoan are fools; the counsel of the prudent counsellors of Pharaoh is become carnal; how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise, the son of the ancient kings?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where are they? Where are thy wise men? Let them tell thee now, or let them cause thee to know what the LORD of the hosts has purposed upon Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Noph are deceived; they have also seduced Egypt, even those that are the stay of the tribes thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has mingled a perverse spirit in its midst, and they have caused Egypt to err in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggers in his vomit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall it be of any value unto Egypt, any work which the head or tail, branch or rush, may do.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day Egypt shall be like unto women, and it shall be afraid and fear in the presence of the tall hand of the LORD of the hosts, which he shall raise up over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land of Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt; every one that makes mention of it shall be afraid in himself because of the counsel of the LORD of the hosts which he has determined against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day five cities in the land of Egypt shall speak the language of Canaan and swear to the LORD of the hosts; one shall be called The city of destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall there be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of Egypt and a pyramid titled “To the LORD” at the border thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto the LORD of the hosts in the land of Egypt; for they shall cry unto the LORD because of the oppressors, and he shall send them a Saviour, and a Prince, and he shall deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know the LORD in that day and shall do sacrifice and oblation; they shall vow vows unto the LORD and perform them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall smite Egypt; he shall smite and heal it because they shall become converted unto the LORD, and he shall grant them clemency and shall heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day there shall be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians shall serve the LORD with the Assyrians.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day Israel shall be the third part with Egypt and with Assyria, even a blessing in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD of the hosts shall bless them, saying, Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year that Tartan came unto Ashdod (when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him) and fought against Ashdod and took it;
speaker: Narrator

text: at the same time the LORD spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, Go and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins and put off thy shoe from thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said, Like as my slave Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and wonder upon Egypt and upon Ethiopia,
speaker: Narrator

text: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians prisoners, and the Ethiopians captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, even with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their hope and of Egypt their glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inhabitant of this isle shall say in that day, Behold, such was our hope which we clung to for help that we might be free from the presence of the king of Assyria. How shall we escape?
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the desert of the sea. As the whirlwinds which pass through the wilderness in the land of the south, so they come from the terrible land.
speaker: Narrator

text: A grievous vision is shown unto me. For one who is treacherous, another who deals treacherously, and for one destroyer, another destroyer. Rise up, Elam; besiege Media; all the sighing thereof I have made to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my loins are filled with pain; pangs have taken hold upon me as the pangs of a woman that travails; I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: My heart panted; the horror frightened me; the night of my pleasure he has turned into fear unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink; arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman who shall declare what he sees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; then he looked with more diligence;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he cried, A lion upon the watchman. My lord, I stand continually all the day and all night long upon my watchtower.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, this chariot of men comes with a couple of horsemen. Afterwards he spoke and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he has broken unto the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my harvest, and the people of my threshing floor, that which I have heard of the LORD of the hosts, the God of Israel, I have declared unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Dumah. He calls to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of this night? Watchman, what of this night?
speaker: Narrator

text: The watchman said, The morning comes and then the night; if ye will enquire, enquire ye; return, and come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest ye shall pass the night in Arabia, O ye walkers of Dedanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go ye out to meet them bringing water for the thirsty, O inhabitants of the land of Tema; succour those who are fleeing with your bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they flee from the presence of the sword, from the presence of the drawn sword, from the presence of the bent bow, from the presence of the grievousness of the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of a hireling, all the glory of Kedar shall be undone:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the residue of the number of valiant archers, sons of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the valley of the vision. What ails thee now that thou art completely gone up to the housetops?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou that art full of tumults, a tumultuous city, a joyous city, thy dead are not slain with the sword nor slain in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy princes together fled from the bow; they were bound; all that were found in thee were bound together; the others fled far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I said, Leave me; I will weep bitterly; do not labour to comfort me of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a day of trouble and of treading down and of wearing down by the Lord GOD of the hosts is sent in the valley of the vision to break down the wall and give a cry unto the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Elam bore the quiver in a chariot of men and of horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, that thy choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the soldiers set themselves in array at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he discovered the covering of Judah, and thou didst look in that day to the house of weapons of the forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have also seen the breaches of the city of David that they are multiplied, and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye have numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and ye have broken down houses to fortify the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye also made a moat between the two walls with the water of the old pool, but ye have not looked unto the maker thereof, nor had respect unto him that fashioned it long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord GOD of the hosts did call in this day unto weeping and to mourning and to baldness and to girding with sackcloth:
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating flesh, and drinking wine while they say, let us eat and drink for tomorrow we shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was revealed in my ears by the LORD of the hosts, That surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you until ye die, saith the Lord GOD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord GOD of the hosts, Go, get thee unto this treasurer, even unto Shebna, which is over the house, and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: What hast thou here? or whom hast thou here that thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here as he that hews himself out a sepulchre on a high place or that graves a habitation for himself in a rock?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the LORD will carry thee away in a hard captivity and will surely cover thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will surely violently turn and toss thee like a ball into a large country, there shalt thou die, and there the chariots of thy glory shall come to an end, the shame of the house of thy Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will drive thee from thy place, and he shall pull thee down from thy state.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that I will call my slave Eliakim the son of Hilkiah:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will clothe him with thy robe and strengthen him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand, and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the key of the house of David I will lay upon his shoulder; so he shall open, and no one shall shut; and he shall shut, and no one shall open.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place, and he shall be for a glorious throne to his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father’s house, the sons and the grandsons, all the vessels of small quantity, from the cups to drink from even unto all the instruments of music.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day, saith the LORD of the hosts, the nail that is fastened in the sure place shall be removed and be cut down and fall and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off: for the LORD has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish, for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in; from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be still, ye inhabitants of the isle; thou mart of Zidon, that by passing over the sea thou wert replenished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her provision was from the plantings that grow with the many waters of the Nile, of the harvest of the river. She was also the mart of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be thou ashamed, O Zidon, for the sea has spoken, even the strength of the sea, saying, I have never travailed nor brought forth children, neither did I nourish up young men nor bring up virgins.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the report comes unto Egypt, they shall be sorely pained at the news from Tyre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days? Her own feet shall carry her afar off to sojourn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has decreed this against Tyre, the crowning city, whose merchants were princes, whose traders were the honourable of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD of the hosts has purposed it to stain the pride of all glory and to bring down all those who are exalted in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pass by as a river from thy land, O daughter of Tarshish; for thou shalt have no more strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out his hand over the sea; he shook the kingdoms; the LORD commanded upon Canaan that her strength should be weakened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon; arise, pass over to Chittim, and even there thou shalt have no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold the land of the Chaldeans. This people was not until the Assyrian founded it for those that dwell in the wilderness; they set up its towers; they raised up its palaces, and he brought it to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl, ye ships of Tarshish, for your strength is laid waste.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years according to the days of one king; after the end of seventy years Tyre shall sing as a harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take a harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing the song again that thou may be remembered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the LORD will visit Tyre, and she shall turn to her hire and shall commit fornication again with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But her profit and her hire shall be consecrated unto the LORD: it shall not be treasured nor laid up for her profit shall be for those that dwell before the LORD, to eat until they are filled and to dress honourably.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the LORD makes the earth empty and makes it naked and turns it upside down and scatters abroad its inhabitants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, as with the people so with the priest; as with the slave so with his master; as with the maid so with her mistress; as with the buyer so with the seller; as with the lender so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury so with the giver of usury to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land shall be utterly emptied and utterly spoiled: for the LORD has spoken this word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth has destroyed itself and fallen; the world has become sick and fallen; the haughty peoples of the earth are become sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is also become bankrupt under its inhabitants because they have transgressed the laws, falsified the order, broken the everlasting covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the curse has consumed the earth, and those that dwell therein are found guilty; therefore, the inhabitants of the earth are consumed, and few men left.
speaker: Narrator

text: The new wine is lost; the vine is sick; all those who were merryhearted sigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mirth of tambourines ceases; the noise of those that rejoice ends; the joy of the harp ceases.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not drink wine with a song; the drink shall be bitter to them that would drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city of confusion is broken down: every house is shut up that no man may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened; the mirth of the land is gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the peoples as the shaking of an olive tree, as the gleanings when the vintage is done.
speaker: Narrator

text: These shall lift up their voice; they shall sing joyfully in the majesty of the LORD; they shall lift up their voice from the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore glorify ye the LORD in the valleys; let the LORD God of Israel be called upon by name in the isles of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the uttermost part of the earth we have heard psalms, Glory to the righteous one. But I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto me! The treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and the pit and the snare are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that he who shall flee from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that shall come up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: because from on high, windows have been opened, and the foundations of the earth shall shake.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shall be utterly broken down; the earth is clean dissolved; the earth is moved exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard and shall be removed like a cottage; and its transgression shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall and never rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the LORD shall visit punishment upon the host of the high ones that are on high and upon the kings of the earth on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be gathered together as prisoners are gathered in the pit and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days they shall be visited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the LORD of the hosts shall reign in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, and in the presence of his ancients he shall be glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, thou art my God; I will exalt thee; I will praise thy name for thou hast done wonders, the counsels of old, the truth unchanging.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou hast turned the city into a heap; the defenced city into a ruin: the palace of strangers to not be a city; it shall never be rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the strong people shall glorify thee; the city of the strong Gentiles shall fear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast been strength to the poor, strength to the needy in his distress, refuge from the storm, shadow from the heat, for the force of the violent is as a storm against the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the heat in a dry place, thou shalt bring down the pride of the strangers; even as with heat that burns beneath a cloud, thou shalt cause the offshoot of the stout ones to wither.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this mountain the LORD of the hosts shall make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of purified wines, of fat things full of marrow, of purified liquids.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will undo in this mountain the mask of the covering with which all the peoples are covered and the veil that is extended over all the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will destroy death forever; and the Lord GOD shall wipe away every tear from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people he shall take away from off all the earth: for the LORD has determined it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be said in that day, Behold, this is our God, whom we have waited for, and he has saved us: this is the LORD, whom we have waited for, we will be glad and rejoice in his saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this mountain the hand of the LORD shall rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall extend his hand in the midst of him as he that swims spreads forth his hand to swim: and he shall bring down his pride with the members of his hands
speaker: Narrator

text: and lay siege to the fortress of thy high walls; he shall humble it and bring it down to the ground, even to the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day they shall sing this song in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; God has appointed saving health for walls and bulwarks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keeps the truth may enter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusts in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust ye in the LORD for ever: for in JAH, the LORD is the strength of the ages:
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has brought down those that dwelt on high; he has humbled the lofty city; he humbled her, even to the ground; he brought her down even to the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foot shall tread her down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O LORD, we wait for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name and to the remembrance of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my soul I desire thee in the night; yea, even as long as the spirit is within me I will seek thee early: for as long as thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let favour be showed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly and will not behold the majesty of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator
