text: LORD, when thy hand is withdrawn, they will not see: but they shall see in the end and be ashamed with the zeal of the people. And fire shall consume thine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought in us all our works.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD our God, other lords have had dominion over us without thee: but in thee only will we remember thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise because thou hast visited and destroyed them and made all their memory to perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast added the Gentiles, O LORD, thou hast added the Gentiles: thou hast made thyself glorious: thou hast extended thyself unto all the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: LORD, in the tribulation they have sought thee, they poured out prayer when thy chastening was upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like as a woman with child, that draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and cries out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have conceived, we have had birth pangs; we have, as it were, brought forth wind; we have not wrought any health in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy dead shall live, and together with my body they shall arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the covering of light, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself, as it were, for a little moment until the indignation is overpast.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the LORD comes out of his place to visit the iniquity of the inhabitant of the earth against himself: the earth also shall disclose her blood and shall no longer cover her slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the LORD with his sore and great and strong sword shall visit punishment upon leviathan the fleeing serpent, and upon leviathan that serpent of double vision; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day sing ye unto the vineyard of the red wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: I the LORD do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest the enemy visit it, I will keep it night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would tread them down, I would burn them together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or who shall take hold of my strength? Make peace with me, yea, make peace with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Days shall come when Jacob shall take root: Israel shall blossom and bud, and the face of the world shall be filled with fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Has he been smitten as he who smote him? or has he been slain as those who slew him?
speaker: Narrator

text: In measure, she shall be chastised in her stalks: he stays his rough wind in the day of the east wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, in this manner shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this shall be all the fruit, the removal of his sin; when he shall return all the stones of the altar, as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder that they may not raise up the groves, or the images of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise the defenced city shall be made desolate, and the habitation shall be forsaken and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down and consume the branches thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: When its boughs are withered, they shall be broken off: women shall come and set them on fire: for this is not a people of understanding: therefore he that made them will not have mercy on them, and he that formed them will show them no favour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the LORD shall smite from the channel of the river Euphrates unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the great shofar shall be blown, and those who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria and the outcasts in the land of Egypt shall come and worship the LORD in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim and to the open flower of the beauty of their glory which is upon the head of the fertile valley of those that are overcome with wine!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one who as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fading flower of the beauty of their glory, which is upon the head of the fertile valley, shall be as the early fig, which comes first before the other fruits of the summer; which when he that looks upon it sees it; as soon as he has it in his hand, he eats it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the LORD of the hosts shall be for a crown of glory and for a diadem of beauty unto the residue of his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sits upon the throne of judgment, and for strength to those that turn the battle to the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink; they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? Those that are weaned from the milk and drawn from the breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:
speaker: Narrator

text: For with stammering lips and another tongue he will speak to this people.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom he said, This is the rest with which ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the LORD shall be unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go and fall backward and be broken and snared and taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, ye scornful men, that have taken rule over this people which is in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with Sheol we are at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood we have hid ourselves:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believes shall not make haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judgment also will I lay to the line and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the time that it goes forth, it shall take you: for it shall come suddenly, by day and by night: and it shall be that the terror only causes one to understand the report.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD shall rise up as in Mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore do not be mockers lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord GOD of the hosts that consumption and destruction are determined upon the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give ye ear and hear my voice; hearken and hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Does the plowman plow all day to sow? does he open and break the clods of his ground?
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has levelled the face thereof, does he not cast abroad the fitches and scatter the cummin and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rye in their place?
speaker: Narrator

text: For his God teaches him to know how to judge and instructs him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff and the cummin with a rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grain is thrashed to make bread; but he will not ever be threshing it, nor shall he grind it with the wheel of his cart, nor crush it with the teeth of his thrashing instrument.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also comes forth from the LORD of the hosts to make his counsel wonderful, and to increase wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye one year to another; the lambs shall cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will camp against thee round about and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt be brought down and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be as that of a spiritist, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the multitude of thy enemies that shall come from afar shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the strong ones shall be as chaff that passes away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be visited of the LORD of the hosts with thunders, with earthquakes, and with great noise, with whirlwind and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the multitude of all the Gentiles that shall fight against Ariel, even all that shall fight against her and their siege weapons, and those that shall distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall even be as he who dreams that he is hungry, and in his dream, he eats; but when he awakes, his soul is empty; and as he who dreams that he is thirsty, and, in his dream, he drinks; but he awakes, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul is still thirsty: so shall the multitude of all the Gentiles be, that shall fight against Mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Become ye dumb, and make others dumb; become ye blind, and blind others: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD has extended upon you the spirit of deep sleep and has closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, he has covered the seers with sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every vision is unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which if it were delivered to one that knows how to read, saying, Read this, I pray thee: he shall say, I cannot; for it is sealed:
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the book were delivered to him that does not know how to read, saying, Read this, I pray thee: he shall say, I do not know how to read.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people sacrifice unto me and honour me with their lips, but have removed their heart far from me, and their worship with which they honour me was taught by the commandment of men:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, I will again do a marvellous work among this people with a fearful miracle: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the prudence of their prudent men shall fade away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto those that hide themselves from the LORD, covering the counsel; and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who sees us? and who knows us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely your subversion shall be as the potter’s clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He did not make me? or shall the vessel say of him that made it, He did not understand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into Carmel a fruitful field, and shall not Carmel be esteemed as a forest?
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day the deaf shall hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see in the midst of darkness, and of gross darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the humble shall grow in joy in the LORD, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the violent one shall be done away with, and the scorner shall be consumed, and all those that rose early unto iniquity shall be cut off:
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that made men to sin in word; those that laid a snare for him that reproved in the gate, and turned that which is just into vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the LORD, who ransomed Abraham, unto the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he shall see his children, the work of my hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and shall sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and those that erred in spirit shall learn understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the sons that leave, saith the LORD, to make counsel, but not of me; to cover themselves with a covering, and not by my spirit, adding sin unto sin!
speaker: Narrator

text: They leave to descend into Egypt and have not asked for a word from my mouth, to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh and to place their hope in the shadow of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the strength of Pharaoh shall become your shame, and the hope in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his princes shall be in Zoan, and his ambassadors have come to Hanes,
speaker: Narrator

text: all shall be ashamed of the people that shall not profit them, nor be a help, nor bring them increase, but a shame, and also a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent; they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Egyptians shall help in vain and to no purpose; therefore I have cried out concerning this that your strength should be to sit still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now go, write this vision before them on a tablet and note it in a book that it may remain unto the last day, for ever, unto all ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: That this is a rebellious people, lying sons, sons that did not desire to hear the law of the LORD:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who say to those that see, See not; and to the prophets, Do not prophesy right things unto us, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:
speaker: Narrator

text: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to leave our presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in violence and perversity and build upon this:
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore this sin shall be to you as an open wall ready to fall and as a breach in a high defence, whose breaking comes suddenly at an instant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your destruction shall be as the breaking of a potter’s vessel that without mercy is broken to pieces so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it even a shard to take fire from the hearth or to take water from the well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel has said; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be even more swift.
speaker: Narrator

text: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five ye shall all flee: until ye are left as a mast upon the top of a mountain and as a banner of example on a hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And therefore will the LORD wait for you, that he may have mercy on you, and therefore will he be exalted having mercy upon you: for the LORD is a God of judgment: blessed are all those that wait for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the people shall dwell in Zion, in Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he who has mercy shall show mercy unto thee; at the voice of thy cry when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord shall give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction; thy rain shall never more be taken away, but thine eyes shall see thy rain:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, that ye not turn to the right hand and that ye not turn to the left hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver and the protection of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Go away from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he shall give the rain unto thy planting when thou shalt sow the ground; and bread of the fruit of the earth, and it shall be fat and fertile: in that day thy cattle shall feed in large pastures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine oxen and thine asses that work the ground shall eat clean grain, which has been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be upon every high mountain and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold as the light of seven days, in the day that the LORD binds up the breach of his people and heals the stroke of their wound.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the name of the LORD comes from afar; his face is blazing and difficult to gaze upon: his lips are full of indignation and his tongue as a devouring fire:
speaker: Narrator

text: And his Spirit, as an overflowing stream, shall break even unto the neck to sift the Gentiles with the sieve of vanity and to put a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall have a song, as in the night in which the Passover is kept and gladness of heart as when one goes with a flute to come into the mountain of the LORD to the mighty One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall cause the power of his voice to be heard and shall cause the lighting down of his arm to be seen, with the indignation of his countenance and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering and tempest and hailstones.
speaker: Narrator

text: For through the voice of the LORD shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in every evil place there shall be a staff that the LORD shall cause to lay upon him with tambourines and harps: and with the strength of heaven he will fight against her.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Tophet is ordained of yesterday for the king of Babylon, it is also prepared; he has deepened and enlarged the pile of her fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD like a stream of brimstone kindles it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to those that go down to Egypt for help; and trust in horses and place their hope in chariots because they are many and in horsemen, because they are valiant, but they did not look unto the Holy One of Israel, neither did they seek the LORD!
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he also is wise to guide evil and will not cause his words to lie but will arise against the house of the evildoers and against the help of those that work iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Egyptian is a man, and not God, and his horses flesh, and not spirit, so that as the LORD shall stretch out his hand, both he that helps shall fall, and he that is helped shall fall down, and they shall all fail together.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the LORD spoken unto me, Like the lion and the young lion roaring on his prey, even if a multitude of shepherds come forth against him, he will not be afraid of their voices, nor abase himself for the noise of them: so shall the LORD of the hosts come down to fight for Mount Zion and for his hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: As birds flying, so will the LORD of the hosts defend Jerusalem; defending, delivering, passing over, and saving it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn ye unto him against whom ye have deeply revolted, O sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you as a sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Assyrian shall fall by the sword, not of a mighty man; and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee from the presence of the sword, and his young men shall faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the banner, saith the LORD, unto whom there is fire in Zion, and unto whom there is a furnace in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, one king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall preside unto judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that man shall be as a hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a hot land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the eyes of those that see shall not be dim, and the ears of those that hear shall hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The vile person shall no longer be called liberal, nor the greedy said to be bountiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the vile person will speak villainy, and his heart will invent iniquity to work unrighteousness and to speak scornfully against the LORD, leaving the soul of the hungry empty and taking away the drink of the thirsty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly the greedy use evil measures: he devises wicked devices to ensnare the simple with lying words and to speak in judgment against the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the liberal devises liberal things; and by liberal things shall he rise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, and the harvest shall not come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make yourselves bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon their breasts they shall lament for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; even upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the palaces shall be forsaken; the noise of the city shall cease; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;
speaker: Narrator

text: until the spirit is poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness is turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field is counted for a forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness shall remain in the fruitful field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness rest and security for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my people shall dwell in a habitation of peace and in secure dwellings and in the refreshing of rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hail, when it shall come down, shall be in the forest; and the city shall be completely laid low.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are ye that sow upon all waters, ye that plow with the ox and with the ass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to thee that dost spoil, and thou wast not spoiled; and dost deal treacherously, and they did not deal treacherously with thee! When thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to dealing treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, have mercy on us; we wait for thee: thou wert the strength of thy people in the beginning, be also our saving health in the time of tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the noise of the tumult the peoples fled; at the lifting up of thyself the Gentiles were scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpillar: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall be exalted; he who dwells on the heights: for he has filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in thy times wisdom and knowledge, and the strength of salvation shall reign: the fear of the LORD shall be his treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, their ambassadors shall cry without: the messengers of peace shall weep bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The highways shall be broken down; the travellers shall cease; he has broken the covenant; he has despised the cities; he does not regard man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth mourns and languishes: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel were shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I will rise up, saith the LORD; now I will be exalted; now I will be lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peoples shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up they shall be burned in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness has surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? Who among us shall dwell with eternal flames?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walks in righteousness, he that speaks uprightly; he that despises the gain of violence, he that shakes his hands from receiving bribes; he that stops his ears to not hear of blood; he who shuts his eyes to not see evil;
speaker: Narrator

text: he shall dwell upon the high places: fortresses of rocks shall be his place of refuge: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine heart shall imagine the terror. Where is the scribe? Where is the receiver of tribute? Where is he that counted the towers?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not see that fierce people, a people of a darker speech than thou can perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou can not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt see Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of its stakes shall ever be removed, neither shall any of its cords be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD shall surely be strong unto us there, a place of broad rivers and wide streams in which no galley with oars shall go, neither shall any great ship pass thereby.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD shall be our judge, the LORD shall be our lawgiver, the LORD shall be our king; he himself will save us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy tacklings are loosed; they did not strengthen well their mast, nor could they spread the sail: {Heb. banner} then the prey of a great spoil shall be divided; even the lame shall take prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be absolved from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come near, ye Gentiles, to hear; and hearken, ye peoples; let the earth hear, and all that is therein, the world and all things that come forth of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the indignation of the LORD is upon all the Gentiles, and his fury upon the entire army of them; he shall destroy them and deliver them to the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their slain shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their carcasses, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the host of heavens shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll; and all their host shall fall down as the leaf falls off from the vine and as the leaf falls from the fig tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the heavens my sword shall become drunk; behold, it shall come down in judgment upon Idumea or Edom and upon the people of my anathema.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sword of the LORD is filled with blood; it is made fat with fatness and with the blood of lambs and goats with the fat of the kidneys of rams, for the LORD has a sacrifice in Bozrah and a great slaughter in the land of Idumea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the unicorns shall fall with them, and the bulls with the calves; and their land shall become drunk with blood, and their dust shall be greased with fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it shall be the day of the LORD’s vengeance and the year of recompenses for the controversy of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into sulphur, and the land thereof shall become burning pitch.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be quenched night nor day; its smoke shall go up for ever; from generation to generation it shall lie waste; no one shall pass through it for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the cormorant and the bittern shall possess it; the owl also and the raven shall dwell in it; and he shall stretch out upon it the line of confusion and the level of desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall call the princes thereof, princes without a kingdom; and all her great ones shall be nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof; and it shall be a habitation of dragons and a court for young owls.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the wild beasts of the island, and the satyr shall cry to his fellow; the screech owl shall have his seat there and find for himself a place of rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall the great owl make his nest and conserve his eggs and hatch his young and gather them under his wings; there shall the vultures also be gathered, each one with his mate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek ye out that which is written in the book of the LORD and read; if one of these is lacking, none is missing with his mate, for his mouth has commanded it, and his same Spirit has gathered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has cast the lot for them, and his hand has divided it unto them by line; therefore they shall have it as an inheritance for ever; from generation to generation they shall dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad; the desert shall rejoice and blossom as the lily.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall blossom abundantly and shall also praise and sing for joy; the honour of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the beauty of Carmel and Sharon. They shall see the glory of the LORD and the beauty of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Comfort ye the tired hands and strengthen the knees that tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to those that are of a fearful heart, Be comforted, fear not; behold, your God comes with vengeance, with recompense; God himself will come and save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the lame one shall leap as a hart, and the tongue of the dumb shall praise; for waters shall be dug in the wilderness, and streams in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: The parched ground shall become a pool and the thirsty land springs of water; in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a highway shall be there and a way, and it shall be called The Way of Holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; and for those in it there shall be someone to go with them, in such a manner that the foolish shall not err therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, nor shall any be found there so that the redeemed can walk there:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ransomed of the LORD shall return and come to Zion with songs; and everlasting joy shall be upon their heads: they shall retain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah and took them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he camped by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the washer’s field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiah’s son, who was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, Asaph’s son, the writer of chronicles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this in which thou dost trust?
speaker: Narrator

text: I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust that thou dost rebel against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou dost trust in the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt upon which if a man leans, it will go into his hand and pierce it, so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou say to me, We trust in the LORD our God; is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou art able on thy part to set riders upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: How, therefore, wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s slaves even if thou art trusting in Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
speaker: Narrator

text: And peradventure am I now come up without the LORD against this land to destroy it? The LORD said unto me, Go up against this land and destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy slaves in the Syrian language, for we understand it, and do not speak to us in the Jewish language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Rabshakeh said, Has my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? Has he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall that they may eat their own dung and drink their own piss with you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rabshakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jewish language and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the king, Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he shall not be able to deliver you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us, this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not hearken unto Hezekiah, for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make peace with me and come out to me and eat each one of his vine and each one of his fig tree and drink each one the waters of his own cistern
speaker: Narrator

text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, The LORD will deliver us. Have any of the gods of the Gentiles delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the god of Hamath and Arphad? Where is the god of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: What god is there among all the gods of these lands that have delivered their land out of my hand that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: But they held their peace and did not answer him a word, for the king had commanded thus, saying, Answer him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe and Joah, the son of Asaph, the writer of chronicles, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe and the elders of the priests covered with sackcloth unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble and of rebuke and of blasphemy, for the sons are come to the breaking of the water, and there is no strength in her who is to bring them forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: It may be the LORD thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to blaspheme the living God and to reprove with the words which the LORD thy God has heard; therefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is still left.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the slaves of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith the LORD, Do not be afraid of the words that thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, that I am sending a spirit in him, and he shall hear a rumour and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Do not let thy God, in whom thou dost trust, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly, and shalt thou be delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have the gods of the Gentiles delivered those whom my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan and Haran and Rezeph and the sons of Eden which were in Telassar?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the king of Hamath and the king of Arphad and the king of the city of Sepharvaim Hena, and Ivah?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah took the letters from the hand of the messengers and read them; and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the LORD and spread them before the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah prayed unto the LORD, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD of the hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between the cherubim, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made the heavens and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline thine ear, O LORD, and hear; open thine eyes, O LORD, and see and hear all the words of Sennacherib, who has sent his messengers to blaspheme the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations and their countries
speaker: Narrator

text: and have cast their gods into the fire, for they were no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone; therefore they have destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD, even thou only.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the word which the LORD has spoken concerning him, Has he despised thee? Has he laughed thee to scorn O virgin daughter of Zion? Has he shaken his head behind thy back O daughter of Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the hand of thy slaves thou hast reproached the Lord, and hast said, By the multitude of my chariots I shall come up to the height of the mountains to the sides of Lebanon, and I will cut down the tall cedars thereof and the choice fir trees thereof; and I will enter into the height of his border and the forest of his Carmel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have dug and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet shall I dry up all the rivers of sustenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast thou not heard long ago how I have done it and of ancient times that I have formed it? Now I have brought it to pass, that thou should be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their inhabitants, of little strength, dismayed and confounded shall be as the grass of the field and as the green shrub as the grass on the housetops, that before it comes to maturity it is dried up.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have understood thy state, thy going out and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into my ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou didst come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as grows of itself; and the second year that which springs of the same: and in the third year ye shall sow and shall reap and shall plant vineyards and shall eat the fruit thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward and bear fruit upward:
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant and from Mount Zion shall come an escape; the zeal of the LORD of the hosts shall do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will defend this city to save it for my own sake and for my slave David’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the LORD went forth and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went and returned and dwelt at Nineveh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz came unto him and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order, for thou shalt die and not live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall and prayed unto the LORD,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, Remember now, O LORD, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer; I have seen thy tears behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the LORD that the LORD will do this thing that he has spoken:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick and was recovered of his sickness:
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in the cutting off of my days; I shall go to the gates of Sheol: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, I shall not see JAH, even JAH, in the land of the living; I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: My dwelling place has been moved and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent; he has cut off my life like a weaver: he has cut me off with sickness: between the day and the night thou shalt consume me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I reckoned that I had until morning. As a lion, he broke all my bones: from the morning even unto the night thou shalt make an end of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I complain; I mourned as a dove; I raised my eyes upward, O LORD, I am suffering violence; comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall I say? He has both spoken unto me, and he himself has done it; I shall walk softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, even unto all those that shall live, in these fifteen years I shall proclaim the life of my spirit in them and how thou caused me to sleep, and afterwards hast given me life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness; but it has pleased thee to deliver my life from the pit of corruption, for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the grave shall not confess thee, nor shall death praise thee; nor shall those that go down into the pit wait for thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who lives, he who lives, even he shall confess thee, as I do this day; the father to the sons shall make known thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is ready to save me: therefore we will sing our psalms in the house of the LORD all the days of our life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaiah then said, Let them take a lump of figs and lay it for a plaster upon the boil and he shall be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Merodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and presents to Hezekiah, for he had heard that he had been sick and was recovered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah rejoiced with them and showed them the house of his precious things, the silver and the gold and the spices and the precious ointments and all the house of his weapons and all that was found in his treasures; there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaiah the prophet came unto king Hezekiah and said unto him, What did these men say? and from where did they come unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me, even from Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All that is in my house have they seen; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not showed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the LORD of the hosts:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house and that which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day shall be carried to Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. He said moreover, At least there shall be peace and truth in my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak ye according to the heart of Jerusalem and cry unto her that her time is now fulfilled that her iniquity is pardoned; for she has received of the LORD’s hand double for all her sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of him that cries in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the LORD; make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places made plain:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glory of the LORD shall be manifested, and all flesh shall see it together, for the mouth of the LORD has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice that said, Cry. And I said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the mercy thereof is as the open flower of the field:
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass withers, the flower fades because the spirit of the LORD blows upon it; surely the people is grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass withers, the open flower fades; but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Zion, that brings good tidings, go up into the high mountain; lift up thy voice with strength O bearer of good tidings of Jerusalem; lift it up, do not be afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord GOD will come with a strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd; he shall gather the lambs with his arm and carry them in his bosom and shall gently lead those that are with young.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand and prepared the heavens with his palm and with three fingers measured the dust of the earth and weighed the mountains in a balance and the hills with weights?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has directed the Spirit of the LORD or being his counsellor has taught him?
speaker: Narrator

text: With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him? Who taught him in the path of judgment and taught him knowledge and showed unto him the way of intelligence?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he causes the isles to disappear as dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Lebanon is not sufficient for the fire, nor all the beasts thereof sufficient for the sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Gentiles are as nothing before him, and they are counted to him as vanity and as less than nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
speaker: Narrator

text: The workman prepares the graven image, and the goldsmith spreads it over with gold and casts silver chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is so impoverished that he has no oblation chooses a tree that will not rot; he seeks unto himself a cunning workman to prepare a graven image that shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have ye not known? Have ye not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have ye not been taught since the land was founded?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is seated upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; he stretches out the heavens as a curtain and spreads them out as a tent to dwell in:
speaker: Narrator

text: He brings the powerful to nothing; he makes the judges of the earth as if they had never been,
speaker: Narrator

text: As if they had never been planted, as if they had never been sown, as if their stock had never taken root in the earth; even blowing upon them, they wither, and the whirlwind takes them away as stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom then will ye liken me, or what shall ye compare me to? saith the Holy One.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your eyes on high and behold who has created these things; he brings out his host by number; he calls them all by their names; none shall be lacking by the greatness of his might and by the strength of his power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest thou, O Israel, My way is hid from the LORD, and my judgment is passed over from my God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast thou not known? Hast thou not heard that the God of the age is the LORD, the Creator of the ends of the earth? He does not faint, nor is he weary; and there is no one that can attain to his intelligence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gives power to the faint; and to those that have no might he increases strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young men faint and are weary; the children stumble and fall;
speaker: Narrator

text: but those that wait for the LORD shall have new strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen unto me, O islands; and let the peoples strengthen themselves; let them come near; then let them speak; let us come near together to judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who raised up righteousness from the east, called him that he might follow him, gave the Gentiles before him, and made him rule over kings? He gave them as the dust to his sword and as driven stubble to his bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He pursued them and passed in peace by the way that his feet had never entered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has wrought and done it? Who calls the generations from the beginning? I the LORD, the first, and I, myself am with those who are last.
speaker: Narrator

text: The isles saw it and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid; they congregated and came.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one helped his neighbour; and each one said to his brother, Be of good courage.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and he that smooths with the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It is well joined and he strengthened it with nails, that it should not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, Israel, my slave, Jacob whom I have chosen, art the seed of Abraham my friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have taken thee from the ends of the earth and called thee from the boundaries thereof and said unto thee Thou shalt be my slave; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not fear for I am with thee; do not be dismayed, for I am thy God, who strengthens thee; I will help thee always; I will always uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all those that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded; they shall be as nothing; and those that strive with thee shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt seek them and shalt not find them, even those that contended with thee; those that war against thee shall be as nothing and as a thing of nought.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am the LORD thy God that holds thy right hand saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not, thou worm Jacob, ye dead of Israel; I will help thee, saith the LORD and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have placed thee as a threshing instrument, as a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth; thou shalt thresh the mountains and beat them small and shalt make the hills as chaff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them; but thou shalt rejoice in the LORD, thou shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poor and needy seek the waters that are not; their tongue fails for thirst; I the LORD will hear them; I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will open rivers in high places and fountains in the midst of the plains; I will turn the wilderness into pools of water and the dry land into springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring forth in the wilderness cedars, thorns, myrtles, and olive trees; I will set in the desert the fir tree and the pine and the box tree together:
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may see and know and take warning and understand together that the hand of the LORD does this, and the Holy One of Israel has created it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Explain your cause, saith the LORD; bring forth your foundations, saith the King of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them bring forth and declare unto us what shall happen; tell us what has happened from the beginning, and we shall consider it in our hearts; and we shall know what his end shall be, and cause us to understand that which is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give us news of that which is to come hereafter that we may know that ye are gods; or at least do good or do evil that we may have something to tell, and together we shall marvel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye are of nothing and your works of vanity; an abomination is he that chooses you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have raised up one from the north, and he came from the rising of the sun; he called in my name and came unto princes as upon clay and as the potter treads clay.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has declared from the beginning, that we shall know? and beforetime that we shall say, He is righteous? yea, there is no one that declares this, yea, there is no one that teaches, yea, there is no one that hears your words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the first that has taught these things unto Zion, and unto Jerusalem I brought the news.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I beheld, and there was no one; and I asked regarding these things, and there was no counsellor; I asked them, and they did not answer a word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they are all vanity; their works are nothing: their molten images are wind and confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold my slave, whom I uphold; my elect, in whom my soul delights; I have put my Spirit upon him; he shall give judgment unto the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not break a bruised reed, nor shall he quench the smoking flax; he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not tire nor faint until he has set judgment in the earth; and the isles shall wait for his law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith God the LORD, the Creator of the heavens and he that stretches them out; he that spreads forth the earth and that which comes out of it; he that gives breath unto the people upon it and spirit to those that walk therein:
speaker: Narrator

text: I the LORD have called thee in righteousness and will hold thee by thine hand; I will keep thee and place thee as my covenant unto the people as light unto the Gentiles
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou might open the eyes of the blind, that thou might bring out the prisoners from the prison and those that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the LORD. This is my name, and my glory I will not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and I declare new things: before they spring forth I tell you of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the LORD a new song and his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea and all that is therein, the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar inhabits; let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout {Heb. command} from the top of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give glory unto the LORD and declare his praise in the islands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD shall go forth as a giant; he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war; he shall cry out a battle cry; he shall prevail against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have long time held my peace; I have been still and refrained myself; now will I cry out like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make waste mountains and hills and dry up all their grass, and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will cause them to walk in paths that they have not known; I will make darkness light before them and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them and not forsake them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be turned back; they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is blind, but my slave? or deaf, as my messenger that I sent? Who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the slave of the LORD,
speaker: Narrator

text: who sees many things and does not warn; who opens his ears and does not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD, jealous for his righteousness, will magnify the law and enlarge it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore this people is robbed and spoiled; all of them shall be snared in holes and hid in prison houses; they shall be for a prey, and no one delivers; for a spoil, and no one saith, Restore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who among you will give ear to this? Who will warn and consider regarding the time to come?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who gave Jacob for a spoil and Israel to the robbers? Did not the LORD? Because we sinned against him, and they did not desire to walk in his ways, neither did they hearken unto his law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he has poured upon him the fury of his anger and the strength of battle; he put fire round about him, yet he was careless; and it set him on fire, yet he did not lay it to heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now thus saith the LORD that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Do not fear, for I have redeemed thee, I have named thee; Thou art mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou dost pass through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee; when thou dost walk through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am the LORD thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Keeper; I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou wast precious in my sight, thou wast worthy of honour, and I have loved thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not fear; for I am with thee: I will bring thy generation from the east and gather thee from the west;
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say to the north wind, Give up, and to the south, Do not keep back; bring my sons from far and my daughters from the ends of the earth
speaker: Narrator

text: even every one that is called by my name, for I have created them for my glory; I have formed them; yea, I have made them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring forth the people that is blind that have eyes and the deaf that have ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the Gentiles be gathered together as one, and let the peoples be joined; who among them can declare this and show us former things? Let them bring forth their witnesses that they may be justified or let them hear and say, It is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, and my slave whom I have chosen that ye may know and believe me and understand that I am he; before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I, am the LORD; and beside me there is no saviour.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared and have saved, and I have showed when there was no strange god among you; therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, that I am God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even before the day was I existed; and there is no one that can deliver out of my hand; if I work, who shall hinder it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon and caused fugitives to descend unto all of them and the clamour of Chaldeans in the ships.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the LORD, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, who makes a way in the sea and a path in the mighty waters;
speaker: Narrator

text: when he brings forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall fall together, and never rise; they are extinct; they are quenched as wick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not remember the former things, nor consider the things of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will do a new thing; it shall come to light quickly; shall ye not know it? I will again make a way in the wilderness and rivers in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls because I give waters in the wilderness and rivers in the desert to give drink to my people, my chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This people I have formed for myself; they shall show forth my praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast not brought me the animals of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices, but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins; thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I, am he that uproots thy rebellions for mine own sake and will not remember thy sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cause me to remember; let us enter into judgment together; declare, thou, that it may be put to thy account.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy first father sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary and have set up Jacob as anathema, and Israel as a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet now hear, O Jacob my slave and Israel, whom I have chosen:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD that made thee and formed thee from the womb, who will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob, my slave, and thou, Jesurun, {Heb. the upright one} whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty and floods upon the dry ground; I will pour my spirit upon thy seed and my blessing upon thine offspring:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall spring up as among the grass, as willows by the water courses.
speaker: Narrator

text: One shall say, I am the LORD’s; and another shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe with his hand unto the LORD and surname himself by the name of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD the King of Israel and his redeemer, the LORD of the hosts; I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who shall call as I do and declare this in advance and set it in order for me, since I made the people of the world? Let them declare unto them the things that are near and the things that shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not fear, neither be afraid; have I not caused thee to hear from of old and declared unto thee beforehand that which was to come? Then ye are my witnesses that there is no God but me, and there is no Strong One that I do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that make a graven image are all of them vanity; and that which is most precious to them is useful for nothing; and they are their own witnesses that they do not see, nor understand; therefore, they shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has formed God? And who cast a graven image that is profitable for nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed; for the workmen, they are of men; even if all of them are gathered together and stand, they shall fear and shall be ashamed together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The smith shall take the tongs; he shall work among the coals; he shall give it form with the hammers and bring forth in it the arm of his strength; though he is hungry and his strength fails: he shall not drink water, even if he faints.
speaker: Narrator

text: The carpenter stretches out his rule; he measures it with a line; he fits it with planes; he marks it out with the compass; he makes it after the form of a noble man, in the likeness of the beauty of a man; that it may remain in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall hew down cedars and take the cypress and the oak, and he shall strengthen himself with the trees of the forest; he shall plant a fir tree, which shall be nourished with the rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man shall then use of it for firewood; for he will take thereof and warm himself; he will kindle it and bake bread; he will also make a god and worship it; he will fabricate an idol and shall kneel down before it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall burn part of it in the fire; with another part thereof he shall eat flesh; he shall roast meat and shall satisfy himself. Afterwards he shall warm himself and say, Aha, I have warmed myself, I have seen fire;
speaker: Narrator

text: the residue of it he turns into god, into his graven image; he humbles himself before it and worships it and prays unto it and says, Deliver me; for thou art my god.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not know nor understand; for he has anointed their eyes that they not see and their hearts that they not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He does not return to his right mind; he does not have knowledge nor intelligence to say, I have burned part of it in the fire; I have also baked bread upon the coals of it; I have roasted flesh and eaten it and shall I make the residue of it an abomination? Do I have to humble myself before the trunk of a tree?
speaker: Narrator

text: The ashes feed him; his deceived heart inclines him, that he not deliver his soul and say, Is not the lie at my right hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember these things, O Jacob and Israel: that thou art my slave: I have formed thee; thou art my slave, O Israel, do not forget me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have undone, as a cloud, thy rebellions, and thy sins, as a mist, return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises, O ye heavens; for the LORD has done it; shout with joy, ye lower parts of the earth; break forth into praise, ye mountains, O forest, and every tree therein, for the LORD has redeemed Jacob, and in Israel he shall be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb, I am the LORD that makes all things, that stretches forth the heavens alone, that spreads abroad the earth by myself;
speaker: Narrator

text: that undoes the signs of the fortune tellers and makes the diviners mad; that turns the wise men backward and makes their wisdom fade away;
speaker: Narrator

text: that awakes the word of his slave and fulfills the counsel of his messengers, that says unto Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited and to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be rebuilt, and I will raise up thy ruins
speaker: Narrator

text: that says to the deep, Be dry, and I will dry up thy rivers
speaker: Narrator

text: that calls Cyrus, my shepherd, and all that I desire, he shall fulfil, by saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built and to the temple, Thy foundation shall be laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD to his Messiah, to Cyrus, whom I have taken by his right hand to subdue Gentiles before him and to loose the loins of kings. To open before him the two-leaved gates; and the gates shall not be shut:
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go before thee and make the crooked places straight; I will break in pieces the gates of bronze and cut in sunder the bars of iron:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give thee the hidden treasures and the well-guarded secrets that thou may know that I am the LORD, the God of Israel, who gives thee thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jacob my slave’s sake and Israel my elect, I have even called thee by thy name: I have surnamed thee, though thou hast not known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the LORD, and there is no one else; there is no God beside me; I shall gird thee, though thou hast not known me
speaker: Narrator

text: that it may be known from the rising of the sun and from where it goes down that there is no one beside me. I am the LORD, and there is no one else.
speaker: Narrator

text: I form the light and create darkness; I make peace and create evil: I am the LORD that does all this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Release, ye heavens, from above, and the clouds shall pour down righteousness; let the earth open up, and let salvation and righteousness bear their fruit; let them produce fruit together; I the LORD have created it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto him that strives with his Maker! Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth. Shall the clay say to him that fashions it, What doth thou make; thy work has no form?
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto him that says unto his father, Why dost thou beget? or to the woman, Why hast thou brought forth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, and his Maker, Ask me of things to come; inquire of me concerning my sons and concerning the work of my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made the earth, and created man upon it, I, even my hands, have stretched out the heavens and I have commanded all their host.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have awakened him in righteousness, and I will make straight all his ways; he shall build my city, and he shall loose my captives, not for price nor for bribes, saith the LORD of the hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, The labour of Egypt, and merchandise of Ethiopia and of the Sabeans, men of stature, shall come over unto thee, and they shall be thine: they shall come after thee; in chains they shall come over, and they shall fall down unto thee; they shall make supplication unto thee, saying, Surely God is in thee; and there is no one else; there is none other beside God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily thou art God, that thou might hide thyself; God of Israel, who saves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be ashamed and also confounded, all of them; all the makers of idols shall go forth ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel is saved in the LORD, eternal salvation; ye shall never be ashamed nor confounded through all ages.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the LORD said that creates the heavens; God himself that forms the earth, he who made it and established it. He did not create it in vain; he created it to be inhabited; I am the LORD; and there is no one else.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not spoken in secret in a dark place of the earth. Not without substance did I say unto the seed of Jacob, Seek ye me; I am the LORD who speaks righteousness, who declares things that are right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble yourselves and come; draw near together, all ye that are escaped of the Gentiles. They have no knowledge that set up the wood of their graven image and pray unto the god that does not save.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell ye, and bring them near; yea, let them take counsel together; who caused this to be heard from the beginning and has declared it from that time, except me, the LORD? and there is no God beside me; a just God and a Saviour; there is no one besides me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto me, and be ye saved, all the ends of the earth; for I am God, and there is no one else.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn by myself; the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness and shall not return, That unto me every knee shall bow; every tongue shall swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto me he shall say, Surely in the LORD is the righteousness and the strength; until he shall come; and all that are incensed against him shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the LORD shall all the generation of Israel be justified and shall glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bel bowed down; Nebo is fallen; their images were placed upon animals and upon beasts of burden that will carry you, laden with yourselves, burden of weariness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stoop, they are fallen together; they could not escape from the burden, and their soul had to go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, O house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, which are borne by me from the belly, which are carried from the womb:
speaker: Narrator

text: And even to your old age I am he, and even to grey hairs I will carry you; I have made, and I will bear; I will carry and will deliver you.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom will ye liken me and make me equal and compare me that we may be alike?
speaker: Narrator

text: They lavish gold out of the bag and weigh silver in the balance and hire a goldsmith, and he makes it a god; they fall down and worship.
speaker: Narrator
