text: They bear him upon the shoulder, they carry him and set him in his place. There he is; he does not move from his place; they cry unto him, and neither does he answer, nor save from the tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this, and be ashamed, bring it again to mind, O ye transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the former things of old, for I am God, and there is no one else; I am God, and there is no one like me,
speaker: Narrator

text: declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:
speaker: Narrator

text: Calling a ravenous bird from the east, the man that executes my counsel from a far country; I have spoken it; I will also bring it to pass; I have purposed it; I will also do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, ye hard of heart, that are far from righteousness;
speaker: Narrator

text: I cause my righteousness to come near; it shall not go away; and my salvation shall not be stayed: and I will place salvation in Zion; and my glory in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon; sit on the ground, without a throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for thou shalt no longer be called tender and delicate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the millstones and grind meal; uncover thy locks, remove the shoes from thy feet, uncover the thigh, pass over the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy nakedness shall be uncovered and thy shame shall be seen; I will take vengeance, and I will not help any man.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for our redeemer, the LORD of the hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sit, be silent, and go into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for thou shalt no longer be called, The lady of kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was wroth with my people; I have profaned my inheritance and given them into thine hand; thou didst show them no mercy; upon the ancient thou hast very heavily laid thy yoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou didst say, I shall be a lady for ever. Until now thou hast not laid these things to heart, neither didst thou remember thy latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now hear this, thou delicate one, that dost sit in confidence and say in thine heart, I am, and no one else beside me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I be fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these two things shall come to thee in a moment in one day; the loss of thy fathers and widowhood: they shall come upon thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries and for the great abundance of thine enchantments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness: thou hast said, No one sees me. Thy wisdom and thine own knowledge; it has deceived thee; for thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and no one else beside me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from where it rises; and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be able to put it off: and destruction shall come upon thee suddenly, which thou shalt not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand now with thine enchantments and with the multitude of thy sorceries in which thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to better thyself, if so be thou may prevail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels. Let now those that contemplate the heavens, those that speculate regarding the stars, those that teach the courses of the moon, stand up and defend thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver their lives from the hand of the flame; there shall not be a coal left to warm at, nor light to sit before it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured, even thy merchants, from thy youth: they shall wander each one to his own way; there shall be no one to save thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob, who call yourselves by the name of Israel, those that are come forth out of the waters of Judah, those who swear by the name of the LORD and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth, nor in righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they call themselves of the holy city and stay themselves upon the God of Israel. The LORD of the hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which happened, I have already declared many days ago; and it went forth out of my mouth, and I published it; I did it suddenly, and it came to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I know that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: I have already declared it many days ago; before it came to pass I showed it to thee: lest thou should say, My idol has done it, my graven image, and my molten image, has commanded these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast heard it, thou hast seen it all; and will ye not declare it? I have showed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are created now, and not in days past; nor before this day hast thou heard them lest thou should say, Behold, I knew them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly thou hast never heard this; certainly thou hast never known this; certainly thine ear was never before opened: for I knew that being unfaithful thou would disobey; therefore, I called thee a rebel from the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my name’s sake I will defer my anger, and for my praise I will wait patiently for thee that I not cut thee off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have refined thee, and not as silver; I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine own sake, even for mine own sake, I will do it, for how should my name be profaned? and I will not give my glory unto another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, O Jacob and Israel, my called; I am he; I am the first, I also am the last.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly my hand founded the earth, and my right hand measured the heavens with the palm; as I named them, they appeared together.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye, assemble yourselves and hear; who is there among them that declares these things? The LORD has loved him, the one who will execute his will on Babylon and his arm upon the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I, have spoken; I have called him: I have brought him, and therefore his way shall be prospered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; from the time that it was done, I was there: and now the LORD God has sent me and his Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has the LORD, thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel said: I am the LORD thy God who teaches thee to profit, who causes thee to walk by the way in which thou dost walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: O that thou would look unto my commandments! Then thy peace would be as a river and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy seed would be as the sand, and the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name would never be cut off nor destroyed from before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come out of Babylon, flee from among the Chaldeans. Give news of this with a voice of joy; publish this; take this news to the end of the earth; say, The LORD has redeemed his slave Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did not thirst when he led them through the deserts; he caused water to flow out of the rock for them; he clave the rock, and the waters gushed out.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no peace for the wicked, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Listen, O isles, unto me, and hearken, ye peoples, from far, The LORD has called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother he has remembered my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has made my mouth like a sharp sword; with the shadow of his hand he has covered me, and made me a clean arrow; in his quiver he has kept me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto me, Thou art my slave, O Israel; in thee I will glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, I have laboured in vain; I have spent my strength for nothing, and in vain; yet surely my judgment is before the LORD and my recompense with my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, saith the LORD, he that formed me from the womb to be his slave, so that Jacob might be converted unto him. But if Israel will not be gathered, even so, yet I shall be esteemed in the eyes of the LORD, and my God shall be my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, It is a light thing that thou should be my slave to wake up the tribes of Jacob and to restore the desolations of Israel; I have also given thee for a light to the Gentiles that thou may be my saving health unto the end of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has the LORD said, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him whom man despises, to him whom the Gentiles abhor, to the slave of the tyrants, Kings shall see and be raised up as princes and shall worship because of the LORD, for faithful is the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has the LORD said, In an acceptable time I have heard thee, and in the day of saving health I have helped thee; and I will preserve thee and give thee for a covenant of people, that thou might awaken the earth, that thou might inherit the desolate heritages;
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou may say to the prisoners, Go forth; and unto those that are in darkness, Show yourselves. Upon the ways shall they be fed, and upon all the high places shall be their pastures.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall never hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun smite them: for he that has mercy on them shall lead them, even by the springs of water he shall feed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will turn all my mountains into a way, and my highways shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, these shall come from far; and, behold, these from the north and from the west; and these from the land of Sinim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; and break forth into singing, O mountains: for the LORD has comforted his people and will have mercy upon his afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zion said, The LORD has forsaken me, and my Lord has forgotten me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can a woman forget her sucking child that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb? Even though they may forget, I will not forget thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands; thy walls are continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy builders shall come in haste; thy destroyers and those that made thee waste shall go forth of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thine eyes round about, and behold: all these gather themselves together, and come to thee. As I live, saith the LORD, thou shalt surely clothe thyself with them all, as with a garment of honour and shalt be girded by them as a bride.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy waste and thy desolate places and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants, and those that destroyed thee shall be separated far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even thy sons which were fatherless, shall say in thine ears, The place is too strait for me; give place to me that I may dwell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say in thine heart, Who has begotten me these, seeing I had lost my children and was desolate, a stranger removed from my land? and who has brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where had they been?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has the Lord GOD said, Behold, I will lift up my hand to the Gentiles and raise up my banner as an example to the peoples: and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers and their princesses thy nursing mothers: they shall bow down to thee with their face toward the earth and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the LORD: for those that wait for me shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captive delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus saith the LORD, Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered: for I will contend with him that contends with thee, and I will save thy sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will feed those that oppress thee with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I the LORD am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, Where is the bill of your mother’s divorce, whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities ye are sold, and for your rebellions was your mother put away,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I came, and no one showed himself; I called, and no one answered. Is my hand shortened at all, that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stink because there is no water and die for thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord GOD has given me the tongue of the wise that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary; he wakes up early, early shall he awaken my ear, that I might hear, as the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord GOD has opened my ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave my back to the smiters and my cheeks to those that plucked off the hair: I did not hide my face from shame and spitting.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord GOD will help me; therefore, I was not ashamed; therefore, I have set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is near that justifies me; who will contend with me? let us stand together; who is my adversary? let him come near to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord GOD will help me; who is he that shall condemn me? behold, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is among you that fears the LORD? Hearken unto the voice of his slave. He who walked in darkness and had no light; let him trust in the name of the LORD and stay upon his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, that all of you kindle fire and are compassed about with sparks; walk in the light of your fire and of the sparks that ye have kindled. From my hand has come this; ye shall be buried in sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken to me, ye that follow after righteous­ness, ye that seek the LORD; look unto the rock from which ye are hewn and to the hole of the pit from which ye are dug.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto Abraham your father and unto Sarah that bore you; for I called him alone and blessed him and multiplied him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD shall surely comfort Zion; he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden and her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving, and the voice of singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, my people, and give ear unto me, O my nation: for the law shall proceed from me, and I will uncover my judgment for a light of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: My righteousness is near; my saving health is gone forth, and my arms shall judge the people; the isles shall wait upon me; and on my arm shall they place their hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look upon the earth beneath; for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment, and those that dwell therein shall perish in like manner; but my saving health shall be for ever, and my righteousness shall never perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; do not fear the reproach of men, neither be afraid of their revilings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my saving health from age to age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the LORD; awake, as in the ancient days, in ages past. Art thou not he who cut off the proud one, and he who smote the dragon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art thou not he who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep; he who turned the depths of the sea into a way, that the redeemed might pass over?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the ransomed of the LORD shall return and come with singing unto Zion; and everlasting joy shall be upon their head; they shall obtain gladness and joy; and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I, am he that comforts you. Who art thou that thou should be afraid of man that is mortal and of the son of man which shall be counted as stubble?
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast already forgotten the LORD thy maker that has stretched forth the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth and hast feared continually every day the fury of the oppressor when he was ready to destroy. But, where is the fury of the oppressor?
speaker: Narrator

text: The prisoner is anxious that he may be loosed and that he should not die in the pit nor that his bread should fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am the LORD thy God that divides the sea and the waves roar; I am thy God; the LORD of the hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: That has placed my words in thy mouth, and I have covered thee with the shadow of my hand, that thou may plant the heavens and lay the foundations of the earth and say unto Zion, Thou art my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the LORD the cup of his fury; thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling and wrung them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no one to guide her among all the sons whom she has brought forth; neither is there any that takes her by the hand of all the sons that she has brought up.
speaker: Narrator

text: These two things are come unto thee; who shall be sorry for thee? desolation, and destruction, and the famine, and the sword. Who shall comfort thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy sons have fainted, they lie at the head of all the streets as a wild bull in a net: they are full of the fury of the LORD, the rebuke of thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now hear this, thou afflicted and drunken, but not with wine:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has thy Lord said, I AM thy God who pleads the cause of his people; Behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, even the dregs of the cup of my fury; thou shalt no more drink it again:
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will put it into the hand of those that afflict thee, which have said to thy soul, Bow down, that we may go over: and thou hast laid thy body as the ground and as the street to those that went over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for from now on the uncircumcised and the unclean shall no longer come into thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shake thyself from the dust; arise and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the LORD, Ye have sold yourselves for nothing; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the Lord GOD said, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian captured them without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the LORD, that my people is taken away for nothing? And those among my people that take rule over them make them to howl, saith the LORD; and my name is continually blasphemed every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my people shall know my name for this reason in that day: for even I that speak, behold, I shall be present.
speaker: Narrator

text: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that brings good tidings, that publishes peace, that brings good tidings of good, that publishes saving health, that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigns!
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of thy watchmen! They shall lift up the voice; together they shall rejoice: for they shall see eye to eye, how the LORD shall return to bring again Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing praises, rejoice together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the LORD has comforted his people, he has redeemed Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has made bare the arm of his holiness before the eyes of all the Gentiles; and all the ends of the earth shall see the saving health of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from there, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the LORD will go before you; and the God of Israel will gather you together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, my slave shall be prospered; he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many rejected thee, in such manner was his likeness and his beauty, disfigured from the sons of men:
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall sprinkle many Gentiles; the kings shall shut their mouths over him: for that which had not been told them they shall see; and that which they had not heard they shall understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall believe our report? and upon whom shall the arm of the LORD be manifested?
speaker: Narrator

text: With all this he shall grow up before him as a tender sprout and as a root out of a dry ground. There is no outward appearance in him, nor beauty. We shall see him, yet nothing attractive about him that we should desire him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is despised and rejected among men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with weakness; and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely he has borne our sicknesses and suffered our pain: and we considered him stricken, smitten of God, and cast down.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was wounded for our rebellions; he was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and by his stripes healing was provided for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: All we like sheep have become lost; we have turned each one to his own way; and the LORD transposed in him the iniquity of us all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth; he was brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he did not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was taken from prison and from judgment; and who shall count his generation? for he was cut off out of the land of the living; for the rebellion of my people he was smitten.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made his grave with the wicked, and his death with the rich; even though he had never done evil, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: With all this the LORD chose to bruise him; subjecting him to grief. When he shall have offered his soul for atonement, he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the will of the LORD shall be prospered in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall see of the travail of his soul and shall be satisfied. And by his knowledge shall my righteous slave justify many, for he shall bear their iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil unto the strong because he has poured out his soul unto death, and he was numbered with the rebellious, having borne the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice, O barren, thou that didst not bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud with joy, thou that didst not travail with child: for more shall be the sons of the desolate than the sons of the married wife, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thine habitations: spare not, lengthen thy cords, and strengthen thy stakes;
speaker: Narrator

text: for thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: neither be thou confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: for thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy Maker shall be thine husband; the LORD of the hosts is his name; and thy Redeemer the Holy One of Israel; The God of the whole earth shall he be called.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit has the LORD called thee, and as a young woman who is put away, said thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a small moment I have forsaken thee; but with great mercies I will gather thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment; but with eternal mercy I will have compassion on thee, said the LORD thy Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is as the waters of Noah unto me: for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth; so I have sworn that I would not be wroth again with thee, nor reprehend thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the mountains shall be removed, and the hills shall tremble; but my mercy shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be changed, said the LORD that has mercy on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted, behold, I will cement thy stones upon carbuncle and lay thy foundations upon sapphires.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thy windows of precious stones, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of stones of great price.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all thy sons shall be taught of the LORD; and the peace of thy sons shall be multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: With righteousness shalt thou be adorned: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear it; and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone should conspire against thee, it shall be without me, whosoever would conspire against thee shall fall before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have created the smith that blows the coals in the fire, and that brings forth the instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the slaves of the LORD, and their justice from me, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ho, every one that thirsts, come ye to the waters, and he that has no money; come ye, buy, and eat; come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do ye spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which does not satisfy? Hearken diligently unto me, and eat ye that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline your ear, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall live; and I will make an eternal covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have given him for a witness to the peoples, a captain and teacher to the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou shalt call a people that thou knowest not, and Gentiles that did not know thee shall run unto thee because of the LORD thy God and for the Holy One of Israel, for he has honoured thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek the LORD while he may be found; call upon him while he is near:
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts: and let him return unto the LORD, and he will have mercy upon him; and to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my thoughts are not as your thoughts, neither are your ways as my ways, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts more than your thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the rain comes down, and the snow from the heavens, and does not return there, but waters the earth and makes it bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower and bread to the eater:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall my Word be that goes forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall be prospered in that for which I sent it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall go out with joy, and be returned with peace: the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree, and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree: and it shall be to the LORD for a name, for an eternal sign that shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, Keep ye judgment, and do righteousness: for my saving health is near to come, and my righteousness to be manifested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that does this, and the son of man that lays hold on it; that keeps from polluting the sabbath, and keeps his hand from doing any evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither let the son of the stranger that has joined himself to the LORD speak, saying, The LORD shall utterly separate me from his people: nor let the eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has the LORD said unto the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths, and choose the things that please me, and take hold of my covenant;
speaker: Narrator

text: even unto them will I give in my house and within my walls a place and a name better than of sons and of daughters: I will give them an everlasting name, that shall never be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the LORD, to serve him, and that love the name of the LORD, to be his slaves, every one that keeps from polluting the sabbath, and takes hold of my covenant;
speaker: Narrator

text: even them will I bring to the mountain of my holiness, and refresh them in the house of my prayer: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices shall be accepted upon my altar; for my house shall be called, House of prayer for all peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord GOD who gathers the outcasts of Israel says, I will still gather upon him his gathered ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye beasts of the field, all ye beasts of the forest; come to devour.
speaker: Narrator

text: His watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant; they are all dumb dogs; they cannot bark; sleeping, lying down, they love to slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these anxious dogs are insatiable, and even the shepherds did not know enough to understand: they all look to their own ways, each one for his gain, from his quarter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and tomorrow shall be as this day, or much more excellent.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous perishes, and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But come here, ye sons of the sorceress, generation of the adulterer and the whore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? Against whom do ye make a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? Are ye not rebellious sons, a lying seed of transgression,
speaker: Narrator

text: inflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clefts of the rocks?
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the smooth stones of the valley is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even unto them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a present. Should I not avenge these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the lofty and high mountain thou hast set thy bed: even there thou didst go up to offer sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behind the doors also and the posts thou hast set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed and made thee a covenant with them; thou didst love their bed wherever thou didst see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou didst go to the king with ointment and didst multiply thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou became wearied in the multitude of thy ways; yet thou didst not say, There is no remedy: thou hast found that which thou wast searching for; therefore thou repented not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of whom hast thou reverenced or feared? Why dost thou lie; that thou hast not remembered me, nor have I come to thy thought? Have I not held my peace even of old, and thou hast never feared me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou criest, let thy companions deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that waits in me shall have the land by inheritance and shall possess the mountain of my holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall say, Clear away, clear away, level the way, take away the stumblingblocks out of the way of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus has said the high and lofty One that inhabits eternity, whose name is The Holy One; I dwell in the high place and in holiness and with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit to cause the spirit of the humble to live and to cause the heart of the contrite ones to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for by me is the spirit covered by the body, and I have made the souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the iniquity of his covetousness I was wroth and smote him: I hid my face and was wroth, and he went on rebelliously in the way of his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen his ways and will heal him: I will lead him also and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
speaker: Narrator

text: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off and to him that is near, said the LORD; and healed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked are like the sea in tempest, that cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no peace, saith my God, for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cry aloud, do not hold back; lift up thy voice like a shofar and preach to my people their rebellion and to the house of Jacob their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: That they seek me daily and want to know my ways, as people that do righteousness and have not forsaken the rights of their God: they ask me of the rights of righteousness and desire to approach God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have we fasted, they say, and thou dost not see? why have we afflicted our soul, and thou dost take no knowledge? Behold, in the day of your fast ye find your own pleasure and exact your own estates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do this day to make your voice to be heard on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict his soul? is it to bow down his head as a bulrush, and to spread sackcloth and ashes under him? wilt thou call this a fast and an acceptable day to the LORD?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not rather the fast that I have chosen, to loose the bands of wickedness, to undo the ties of oppression, to release into freedom those who are broken, and that ye break every yoke?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not to share thy bread with the hungry and that thou bring the poor that are cast out into thy house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him; and that thou not hide thyself from thy brother?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall spring forth speedily: and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the LORD shall gather thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou call, and thou shalt hear the LORD; thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I am. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking vanity;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if thou pour out thy soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul; then shall thy light rise in obscurity, and thy darkness be as the noonday:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters do not fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall build up out of thee the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the fallen foundations of many generations; and thou shalt be called, The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath, from doing thy will on my holy day; and call the sabbath the delightful, holy, glorious day of the LORD; and shalt honour him by not doing thine own ways, nor seeking thine own will, nor speaking thine own words:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou delight thyself in the LORD; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth and cause thee to eat of the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the LORD has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the LORD’s hand is not shortened, that it cannot save; nor his ear heavy, that it cannot hear:
speaker: Narrator

text: But your iniquities have separated between you and your God, and your sins have hid his face from you, that he will not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with iniquity; your lips pronounce lies; your tongue speaks evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one calls for righteousness, nor do any judge by the truth; they trust in vanity, and speak vanities; they conceive trouble and bring forth iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hatch cockatrice’ eggs and weave the spider’s web; whosoever shall eat of their eggs shall die, and if they should squeeze them, a viper shall come out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their cloth is unfit to be a garment, neither shall they cover themselves with their works; their works are works of violence, and the work of iniquity is in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood; their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; wasting and destruction are their paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of peace they did not know; nor is there anything straight about their ways; they have wilfully made themselves crooked paths; whosoever goes therein shall not know peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore judgment has withdrawn from us, and righteousness has never overtaken us: we wait for light, but behold obscurity; for brightness, but we walk in darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: We grope for the wall like the blind, and as if we had no eyes we walk by touch; we stumble at noonday as in the night; we are in graves as dead men.
speaker: Narrator

text: We all roar like bears and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, but there is none; for saving health, but it has withdrawn from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our rebellions are multiplied before thee, and our sins have testified against us; for our iniquities are with us; and we know our sins:
speaker: Narrator

text: To rebel and to lie against the LORD, and to depart away from our God; the speaking of libel and rebellion, to conceive, and to speak from the heart words of falsehood,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that which is right has departed, and righteousness withdrew afar off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equity could not enter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the truth was taken captive; and he that departed from evil was imprisoned: and the LORD saw it, and it was displeasing in his eyes because that which is right was lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saw that there was no man and wondered that there was no intercessor; therefore his arm brought salvation unto him, and his righteousness, it sustained him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he put on righteousness as a coat of mail, and a helmet of saving health upon his head; and he put on the garments of vengeance for clothing and was clad with zeal as a cloak,
speaker: Narrator

text: so as to give payment, so as to repay the vengeance of his enemies, and repay his adversaries; to the islands he will give recompense.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall they fear the name of the LORD from the west, and his glory from the rising of the sun; for he shall come like a violent river impelled by the breath {Spirit} of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Redeemer shall come to Zion and unto those that turn from the rebellion in Jacob, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be my covenant with them, said the LORD; My spirit that is upon thee, and my words, which I have put in thy mouth, shall not depart out of thy mouth, nor out of the mouth of thy seed, nor out of the mouth of thy seed’s seed, saith the LORD, from now on and for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, shine; for thy light is come, and the glory of the LORD is risen upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the peoples: but the LORD shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gentiles shall walk to thy light, and the kings to the brightness of thy birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thine eyes round about and see: they all gather themselves together; they come to thee; thy sons shall come from far, and thy daughters shall be nursed at thy side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shall see, and thou shall shine, and thine heart shall marvel, and be enlarged because the abundance of the sea shall be converted unto thee, the strength of the Gentiles shall have come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The multitude of camels shall cover thee, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all those from Sheba shall come: they shall bring gold and incense; and they shall show forth the praises of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together unto thee, rams of Nebaioth shall be served unto thee: they shall be offered up with grace upon my altar, and I will glorify the house of my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who are these that fly as a cloud, and as the doves to their windows?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the isles shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish from the first, to bring thy sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, unto the name of the LORD thy God, and to the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of strangers shall build up thy walls, and their kings shall serve thee; for in my wrath I smote thee, but in my good favour I shall have mercy on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thy gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day nor night; that the strength of the Gentiles may be brought unto thee, and their kings guided.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the people or the kingdom that will not serve thee shall perish and shall be utterly wasted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of Lebanon shall come unto thee, the fir tree, the pine tree, and the box together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will honour the place of my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons also of those that afflicted thee shall come humbled unto thee; and at the steps of thy feet all those that despised thee shall bow themselves down; and they shall call thee, The city of the LORD, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereas thou hast been forsaken and hated, so that no man went through thee, I will place thee in eternal glory, in joy from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also suck the milk of the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breast of the kings: and thou shalt know that I the LORD am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for the stones iron; I will also put peace in the place of thy government, and righteousness in the place of thine oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, wasting nor destruction within thy borders; but thou shalt call thy walls Saving Health and thy gates Praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun shall no longer be thy light by day; nor shall the moon give light unto thee for brightness; but the LORD shall be unto thee an everlasting light and thy God thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy sun shall set no more; neither shall thy moon wane: for the LORD shall be thine everlasting light, and the days of thy mourning shall be ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy people shall all be righteous; they shall inherit the land for ever; they shall be shoots of my planting, the work of my hands, that I may be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: The small one shall be as a thousand; the youngest as a strong nation; I the LORD will hasten it in its time.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me because the LORD has anointed me; he has sent me to preach good tidings unto those who are cast down; to bind up the wounds of the broken-hearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to those that are bound;
speaker: Narrator

text: to proclaim the year of the LORD’s favour, and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all that mourn;
speaker: Narrator

text: to order in Zion those that mourn, to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the LORD, that he might be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall build the old wastes; they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall restore the waste cities, the desolations of many generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall be named the Priests of the LORD; men shall call you the Ministers of our God; ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and with their glory ye shall be lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead of your double shame, and your dishonour, they shall praise you in your inheritance; therefore in your land ye shall possess double, and ye shall have everlasting joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I the LORD love that which is right, I hate robbery for burnt offering; and I will confirm your work in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles and their offspring among the peoples; all that saw them shall acknowledge them that they are the seed which the LORD has blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD; my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he has clothed me with the garments of saving health; he has surrounded me with the robe of righteousness; as a bridegroom he has arrayed me, and as a bride made up of his jewels.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the earth brings forth her shoot and as the garden causes her seed to spring forth so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Zion’s sake I will not hold my peace; and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest until her righteousness goes forth as brightness and her saving health is lit as a flaming torch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness and all the kings thy glory; and thou shalt be given a new name, which the mouth of the LORD shall name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the LORD and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt no longer be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any longer be termed Desolate; but thou shalt be called Hephzibah {Heb. my will in her} and thy land Beulah; {Heb. married} for the will of the LORD shall be in thee, and thy land shall be married.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as a young man marries a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee; and as the bridegroom rejoices with the bride, so shall thy God rejoice with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night; ye that make mention of the LORD, do not keep silent
speaker: Narrator

text: and give him no rest, until he establishes and until he makes Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no longer give thy wheat to be food for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for which thou hast laboured:
speaker: Narrator

text: But those that have gathered it shall eat it and praise the LORD; and those that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; clear up, clear up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a banner as an example for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the LORD has caused it to be heard unto the end of the earth; Say unto the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy Saviour comes; behold that his reward is with him, and his work before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the LORD; and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this that comes from Edom, with red garments from Bozrah? This glorious one in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treads in the winefat {Place where grapes are tread}?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the peoples there was no one with me; for I have trodden them with my anger and have trampled them with my fury; and their blood sprinkled my garments and stained all my raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the day of vengeance is in my heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I looked, and there was no one to help; and I wondered that there was no one to uphold me; therefore my own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have trampled down the people with my anger and made them drunk in my fury, and I brought down their strength to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will mention the mercies of the LORD and the praises of the LORD according to all that the LORD has bestowed on us and the greatness of his goodness toward the house of Israel, which he has bestowed on them according to his mercies and according to the multitude of his mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said, Surely they are my people, sons that do not lie: and he was their Saviour.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the Angel of his face saved them: with his love and with his clemency he redeemed them; and he bore them and carried them all the days of the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were rebels and angered his holy Spirit; therefore, he was turned to be their enemy, and he himself fought against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he remembered the days of old, of Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? Where is he that put his Holy Spirit within him?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that led them by the right hand of Moses with the arm of his glory, he who divided the water before them, thus making himself an everlasting name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that led them through the deep, as a horse in the wilderness, they never stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit of the LORD pastored them as a beast that goes down into the valley; so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory; where is thy zeal and thy strength, the feeling of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel not acknowledge us; thou, O LORD, art our father; our everlasting Redeemer is thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: O LORD, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways? Hast thou hardened our heart to thy fear? Return for thy slaves, for the tribes of thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of thy holiness have possessed the promised land but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have been like those over whom thou didst never rule, who were never called by thy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that thou would rend the heavens, that thou would come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
speaker: Narrator

text: as when the melting fire burns, the fire causes the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the Gentiles may tremble at thy presence!
speaker: Narrator

text: As thou didst come down when thou didst terrible things which we did not look for, that the mountains flowed down at thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor have men heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen a God beside thee, that thou might do it again for the one who waits in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst come out to meet him that with rejoicing had worked righteousness. In thy ways they remembered thee. Behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: thy ways are eternal, and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we were all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses as filthy rags; and we all fell as the leaves of a tree; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there is none that calls upon thy name, that wakes himself up to take hold of thee; therefore, thou hast hid thy face from us and hast allowed us to wither in the power of our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, O LORD, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; such that we all are the work of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever; behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our house of our Sanctuary and of our glory, where our fathers praised thee, was burned up with fire; and all our precious things were destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou refrain thyself regarding these things, O LORD? Wilt thou hold thy peace and afflict us very sore?
speaker: Narrator

text: I was sought of those that did not ask for me; I was found of those that did not seek me; I said, Here I am, Here I am, unto a people that did not invoke my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, who walk in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;
speaker: Narrator

text: a people that provokes me to anger continually to my face; that sacrifices in gardens, and burns incense upon altars of brick;
speaker: Narrator

text: who remain asleep among the graves, and lodge in the deserts, who eat swine’s flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
speaker: Narrator

text: who say, Stand by thyself, do not come near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burns all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,
speaker: Narrator

text: For your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the LORD, who have burned incense upon the mountains and blasphemed me upon the hills; therefore, I will measure their former work into their bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus has the LORD said, As when one has found new wine in a cluster and says, Do not destroy it; for a blessing is in it; so will I do for my slaves’ sakes, that I may not destroy them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains; and my elect shall possess the land for an inheritance, and my slaves shall dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sharon shall be for a fold of flocks and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye that forsake the LORD, that forget the mountain of my holiness, that prepare a table unto fortune, and that furnish the drink offering for destiny;
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will destine you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter because when I called, ye did not respond; I spoke, and ye did not hear, but did evil before my eyes and did choose that which displeased me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus has the Lord GOD said, Behold, my slaves shall eat, but ye shall be hungry; behold, my slaves shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty; behold, my slaves shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, my slaves shall rejoice by the joy of their heart, but ye shall cry for the sorrow of your heart and shall howl for the destruction of spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen; for the Lord GOD shall slay thee and call his slaves by another name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who blesses himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that swears in the earth shall swear by the God of truth because the former troubles shall be forgotten and shall be covered from my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth; and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall be glad and rejoice from age to age in the things which I shall create; for, behold, I create joy unto Jerusalem and unto her people joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will be glad with Jerusalem and rejoice with my people: and the voice of weeping shall no longer be heard in her, nor the voice of crying.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall no longer be there an infant of days, nor an old man that has not filled his days, for the child shall die one hundred years old; and he who sins at one hundred years of age shall be accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall build houses and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of the trees shall be the days of my people, and my elect shall perpetuate the work of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not labour in vain, nor give birth with fear; for their births are the seed of the blessed of the LORD, and their offspring shall be with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wolf and the lamb shall be fed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the ox; and dust shall be the serpent’s food. They shall not afflict nor do evil in all my holy mountain, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the LORD, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where shall remain this house that ye built unto me? and where shall remain this place of my rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: For all these things my hand has made, by my hand has these things been, said the LORD; but to this man will I look, even to him that is poor and of a contrite spirit and trembles at my word.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that kills an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrifices a lamb as if he cut off a dog’s neck; he that offers an oblation as if he offered swine’s blood; he that burns incense as if he blessed iniquity. They have chosen their own ways, and their soul delights in their abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will choose their delusions and will bring their fears upon them because I called, and no one answered; I spoke, and they did not hear: but they did evil before my eyes and chose that which displeased me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the word of the LORD, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hate you, that deny you for my name’s sake, said, Let the LORD be glorified; but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice of noise from the city, a voice of the temple, a voice of the LORD that renders recompense to his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has heard such a thing? Who has seen such things? Shall the earth bring forth in one day? Shall an entire nation be born at once? that Zion travailed, and shall bring forth her sons together?
speaker: Narrator

text: I, who make births to happen, shall I not be with child? saith the LORD; I, who causes conception, shall I be stopped? saith thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: be filled with joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the splendour of her glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream; then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne upon her sides, and be dandled upon her knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a man child whom his mother comforts, so will I comfort you; and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall see, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like grass; and the hand of the LORD shall be known toward his slaves and his indignation toward his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, the LORD will come with fire and with his chariots like a whirlwind to render his anger with fury and his rebuke with flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by fire and by his sword will the LORD judge all flesh; and the slain of the LORD shall be multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that sanctify themselves and purify themselves in the gardens, one behind another; those that eat swine’s flesh and abomination, and the mouse shall be cut off together, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I understand their works and their thoughts. The time shall come to gather all the Gentiles and tongues; and they shall come and see my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set a sign among them, and I will send those that escape of them unto the Gentiles, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, that draw the bow, to Tubal, and Javan, to the isles afar off, that have never heard my name, nor seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the LORD from among all the Gentiles, upon horses and in chariots and in litters and upon mules and upon camels to my holy mountain of Jerusalem, saith the LORD, so that the sons of Israel bring the offering in clean vessels to the house of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will also take of them for priests and for Levites, saith the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I make, shall remain before me, saith the LORD, so shall your seed and your name remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass that from one new moon to another and from one sabbath to another all flesh shall come to worship before me, said the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall go forth and look upon the carcasses of the men that rebelled against me; for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
speaker: Narrator
